name: Boxing
description:
Welcome to Lancaster University Boxing Club
-------------------------------------------

Lancaster University Boxing Club welcomes people of all levels, from complete beginners, to experienced and competitive boxers.

Our sessions are run by Dan, an England Boxing qualified coach, with the help of our exec members. These classes will teach you all the basic skills used in boxing, and help you to progress over the year, leading to various opportunities including competing for the university, and visits to external clubs for sparring and training sessions.

For anyone looking to progress into competing we compete white collar and England Boxing. This year we are aiming to host an EB show at home in term 2. We will also be hosting Roses, a white collar competition against York University in term 3.

While we provide these opportunities, there is no pressure on competing or sparring, many of our members happily train just for fitness as boxing is an enjoyable way to exercise with friends. We also host regular socials so you will meet new people throughout the year!

Sessions and Training Times
---------------------------

We usually hold 3 sessions a week in the following locations.

*   Monday: 8-10pm George Fox
*   Wednesday: 6-8 pm County South LT
*   Sunday (Sparring): 2-4 pm George FoxÂ 

Sessions begin on Monday the 9th of October. Any changes to session times will be updated on here and the lu\_boxing instagram page.

Prices
------

Information for 2023/24

*   Membership for the whole academic year is Â£15. You will receive a reduced price for sessions, a free pair of hand wraps.
*   Membership for a singleÂ term will cost Â£10 and expire at the end of that term
*   Sessions can be paid for via cash or card

*   Each sessionÂ will cost Â£5 without a membershipÂ or Â£3.50 for those with membership. The first session you attend is free!

The Exec
--------

*   President - Raphael Thorn
*   Vice President - Callum Levitt
*   Treasurer - Daniel McHamilton
*   Secretary - Rosie Davies
*   Social Secretaries - Elizabeth Ryan + Rahul Patel
*   Kit Officer - Tom Maudsley
*   Health and Safety Officer - Emery Reza

name: Lancaster Young Greens Society
description:
We are the student branch of the Green Party of England and Wales at Lancaster University â€“ supporting and promoting the values and policies of the Green Party both on campus and in the local community. There are many benefits to joining the LYG, but to name a few, you will have the opportunity to get involved in local and national activism, attend protests, debate with others interested in green politics, learn more about the values of the Green Party, and support and join the local party. Not to mention become part of a friendly and welcoming community.Â 

Whether you're an experienced activist, ready to throw yourself into all things Green or just wanting to meet like-minded people, this is a space for everyone. You can be involved in as little or as much as you like.Â 

Membership of the Green Party isn't required, all we ask is that you support and promote our [core values](https://policy.greenparty.org.uk/core-values.html). However if you do want to become a member it's completely free!

We host weekly meetings/Â socialsÂ â€“ ranging from film nights and banner-making to quizzes,Â bar crawls and guest speakers. If youâ€™re interested in joining the society, or just want to see what weâ€™re about, please donâ€™t hesitate to contact us on one of our social media pages below or come along to a meeting or social!Â 

Instagram â€“ luyounggreensÂ 

Facebook â€“ LUGreenSociety

name: The Redeemed Christian Campus Society
description:
This is The Redeemed Christian Campus Society established to raise role models after the Christian faith, who will not only excel in their academics but also bring this excellency to bear on their community thereby engendering new followership of believers to this faith an excellent way.

We are fully committed to raising a people with an unshakeable commitment to holiness and a passion for Godliness, a people to whom excellence in life is not just an aspiration but a mandate.

We meet on Wednesday at 7 pm on campus.Â 

Follow us on Instagram for the latest updates about our events: lu\_redeemedfellowship

Bringing together Greeks and Cypriots, as well as anyone else who would be interested in getting to know the Greek culture through events and activities.Â For any info donâ€™t hesitate to contact us.

And for non-Thai students, we are hoping to show them the Thai cultural values including traditional Thai food, culture, and language through different activities. Anyone is welcome whether they are Thai or interested in Thai culture.Â Â

description:
_If you're interested in starting ballet for the first time or perfecting those pirouettes, this is the society for you!_

Lancaster University Ballet Society is a recreational dance society, we prioritise the fun and relaxed side of learning ballet and encourageÂ beginners or even intermediate and advanced dancers to join our classes :)

We offer ballet classes taught by a professional dance teacher as well as strengthening and flexibility-focused sessions and choreography sessions (both run by the exec).Â We also organise socials to get to know each other and have a laugh either it be in a movie night (completed withÂ pizza!)Â or dancing the night away in Sugar!

name: German Society
description:
**\- Welcome to LANCASTER UNIVERSITY GERMAN SOCIETY -**  
Our goal is to encourage intercultural exchange and foster friendships between Germans and non-Germans by providing a platform for mutual exchange. We regularly organise social events (on and off campus), film evenings and tripsÂ Â 

Who can join? - Anybody! You don't have to be able to speak German to come along. As long as you have an interest in German culture and lifestyle, and want to have a good time with a group of friendly and enthusiastic people then we're the society for you.

Become a Member The German Society

The German Society is open for all students at Lancaster regardless of their country of origin or degree. Joining the society comes with lots of benefits such as participation rights. To join press the "Join this Group" Button on this page.  
Â 

What do we do?  
\-Film evenings  
\-Regular social events both on and off campus  
\-Food and drink evenings  
\-Pub games  
\-Trip to Manchester Chrismas market  
  
Details for socials and other events will be published on Instagram and our WhatsApp group.

To stay up to date, make sure to follow our social media pages and become a member of our group so that you do not miss out!

**Instagram**: https://twitter.com/lugermansoc

**Facebook**: **https://www.facebook.com/lugermansoc**

name: Whosoc (Doctor Who Society)
description:
Hello! Would you like a Jelly Baby? A jammy dodger? Would you care for some tea?

We are WhoSoc (officially the Lancaster University Doctor Who Society)! We are a community where the Doctor Who fans of Lancaster gather for weekly socials based around the Greatest Show in the Galaxy.

Whether youâ€™ve seen every episode since the 60s (well done you!), or started watching as a Resolution (see what we did there?), we welcome your enthusiasm and opinions to join the society.

Our socials are on Tuesday nights (usually starting at 7pm) or Saturday during the day, where we watch episodes, have quiz/games nights, go on cake crawls around town and so much more. Attendance isnâ€™t mandatory, but weâ€™d love to see you as often as you can make it.

Allons-y!

To be a full-time member of the society for 2023/24Â academic year, membership is only Â£3.00. To become a member of the society please click the orange button that states 'JOIN THIS GROUP' and pay the membership fee or alternatively sign up withÂ a free temporary expression of interest membership. N.B. the temporary expression of interest membership will expire after the first 3 socials of 1st term and you will not be eligible to stand for an executive position in elections without full membership.Â 

Feel free to get in touch with us viaÂ the FacebookÂ group, inbox the Facebook page,Â via email, through our new Instagram account or via any of the other social media accounts listed belowÂ if you have any queries or would like to know more about what we do as a society!

We hope you enjoy the society and what itÂ offers. If you have any suggestions on how we can improve your experience, then please do not hesitate in sharing your ideas with the exec. We will try our hardest to host live screenings when possible, but this may not always be possible.

Advice and assistance available immediately, members of the Exec respond to all inquiries, and can be contacted below:

Email: whosoc@live.com

Twitter: WhoSoc Lancaster (@whosoc)

Tumblr: [http://whosoc.tumblr.com/](http://whosoc.tumblr.com/)

Facebook page: [https://www.facebook.com/whosoc](https://www.facebook.com/whosoc)

Instagram: LU Doctor Who Society (@luwhosoc)

name: Muay Thai Boxing
description:
What is Lancaster Muay Thai?Â 

Muay Thai, also know as the "Art of 8 limbs",Â is the most fundamental striking martial art you can learn. It utilizes attacking with the entire body, with effective punches, kicks, knees, elbows, sweeps, and some grappling. Techniques focus on simplicity, efficiency and tremendous power.

Outside of training, we are very active with regular socials, ranging from low-key movie nights,Â belta nights out, and everything else in between.

Prices

*   Â£60Â for the full year
*   Â£30Â per term

Plus one off seminars from elite fighters and coaches! (Seminar prices to be confirmed)

Training times (Subject to Change, Check our Socials!)

*   Tuesday: County South - 6-8pm
*   Thursday: County SouthÂ - 6-8pm
*   Sunday: George Fox - 4-6pm (Session with coach, in collaboratio with Kickboxing Society)

Key informationÂ Â Â Â 

*   We cater for complete beginners all the way to interclub level
*   All equipment providedÂ 
*   You only need to bring comfortable sportswear
*   If you would like to partake in sparring then you will need a gumshield

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Lancaster Muay Thai is on the map, after successfully competing in interclubs across 5 major cities in the UK, as well as competing in fight nights in Durham and Leeds in 2021-22. We are excited about future opportunities.

name: Engineering Society
description:
If youâ€™ve ever watched robot wars, Red Bull Soap box, Real Steel, or even enjoyed playing around with â€Lego as a kid, and wanted to do learn the skills to do the above, and more, **LU EngSoc** is the place for you.

The Lancaster University Engineering Society brings together academic, social, and career-centric opportunities. It combines future-focused, CV orientated opportunities with â€˜old Top Gearâ€™ spirit, with slightly less calamity. Think less â€œ_ambitious, but rubbish_â€, and more â€œ_ambitious, but slightly competent and educational_â€.

Be you a first year wanting to find extra support in getting to the swing of university content, a third year looking for opportunities to blow off some steam outside of the course, or even a bored student doing a course completely unrelated to engineering, weâ€™re the perfect society for you.

Weâ€™re running several major projects, workshops, networking events, and chilled-out socials this academic year; with our **low barrier-for-entry of Â£5**, the membership basically pays for itself with the glamorous welcome email alone.

We look forward to seeing you upon joining!

_Any lingering questions? Shoot them our way:_ [_engsoc@lancaster.ac.uk_](mailto:engsoc@lancaster.ac.uk)

_Or check out our_ [_Facebook_](https://www.facebook.com/groups/LUEngSoc/) _or_ [_Instagram_](https://www.instagram.com/luengsoc/?hl=en-gb) _for more info on events on the horizon._

name: Futsal
description:
Welcome to Lancaster University Futsal Club! For those of you who don't already know, futsal is probably best described as indoor football with more rules. It is 5 a side, the ball is smaller and slightly weighted, and whilst there is a place for all the skills you see in montages on facebook, the game is more about tactics and fitness. The sport is rapidly growing in both the UK and at Lancaster University.

It was only introduced into the Roses competition with York in 2015.Â InÂ the 18/19Â season, we had one of our most successful years ever, winning the league and beating York at Roses for 4 points and our first win for the club in this tournament.Â Our first year back post covid proved to be succesful, we finished 2nd in the league. However, we want to push on now and with a very ambitious squad full of quality, our intention is to bring the league home. We are going to be having trials in October to recruit new team members. Check out our Facebook and Instagram pages to find out more, and hopefully for those who donâ€™t make the team, there will be a casual futsal session once a week.

name: Vegetarian and Vegan
description:
As there are around 13,000 students at Lancaster, it can be quite overwhelming and you may not really know where to begin when it comes to finding likeminded students. This is where LUVeg comes in! Our purpose is to give veggies and non-veggies alike opportunities to socialise, eat good food and have a great time, and sometimes even learn some new skills from cooking demos to activism.

We host weekly events includingÂ potlucks on campus where members bring vegÂ food they've bought or made for us allÂ to share and enjoy.Â Join our facebook group and you'll be invited to each one!Â We also love our meals out atÂ veg-friendly restaurantsÂ in Lancaster.Â If your more interested in learning more about the vegan and vegetarian lifestyle, we do inviteÂ **guest speakers** to attend the university for talks and organise several **film and documentary showings** throughout the term to show you the wonderful positive differences you can make simply by changing what you eat. We also organise visits toÂ **V****egan/Vegetarian festivals** in the North, where we get to meet like-minded peopleÂ and empty our wallets on food, apparel and gifts of every kind - all cruelty-free and every penny going towards veg-friendly causes!

We are a very relaxed, friendly society with a wonderfully diverse range of members from all walks of life, so you're sure to find a friend or two (or more hopefully!) here! Our main aim is to create a community of like-minded people :) We look forward to seeing you at our next event!

\[_Follow us on instagram_: @luvegsoc and find us on Facebook by searching Lancaster University vegetarian and vegan society\]

name: Korfball
description:
Do you want to join a friendly club and meet new people,Â allÂ whilstÂ playing theÂ world's only fully mixed-genderÂ sport? How do you feel about taking up a sport thatâ€™ll take you to destinations all over the UK, and even across Europe,Â where youâ€™ll meet, play, and party with other Korf-mad students, just like yourself? Â 

**If that sounds like you, then thereâ€™s only one club you need to join** **\- Lancaster University Korfball Club!**Â 

Our club hasÂ threeÂ teams who compete in weekly league matches against teams in the North West, represent Lancaster University at 3 weekendly BUCS tournaments, and attend numerous tournaments all over the UK (andÂ even inÂ Amsterdam)! The majority of our players have never played korfball before and know how daunting joining a new club can be, so don't be apprehensive, come on down to training and you'll soon pick it up!Â 

  
We currently train twice a week on **Monday 5pm-6:30pm** andÂ **Wednesday 7am-9am**Â at the University Sports Centre's Sports Hall although we're hopeful of arranging a third weekly session for the second half of term 1! Trainings are a mixture of club sessions (where members of all abilities play together) and team sessions (where individual teams are taught separately by our coaches).

Our designated taster sessions for term 1 have already taken placeÂ however if you couldn't make these and still want to try korfball, get in touch with us through our socials and we'll find time for you to come give it a go!Â Plus, if you're new to the sport, we'reÂ hosting ourÂ annual â€˜Freshers Tournamentâ€™ in October where teamsÂ fromÂ allÂ overÂ theÂ country bringÂ their beginners to play. After all,Â there is no better way to learn the game than by playing it!

Visit our social medias: @lancsunikorfball (Instagram), Lancaster University Korfball Club (Facebook) or drop us an email (korfball.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk)Â if youÂ haveÂ anyÂ questions. We can't wait to see you soon!

We are a group of LU students interested in promoting fitness while at uni. We have a range of members from beginners to advanced who take part inÂ regular workouts, classes and socials to promote physical fitness alongside our studies.

What isÂ Calisthenics?

**Calisthenics** is a type of workoutÂ that uses a person's body weight with little or no equipment. The exercises involve movements that use large muscle groups. People typically perform these exercises at a moderate pace. They help to improve coordination, flexibility, and strength.

All of our fitness sessions include workouts that are completely inclusive for beginners, as well as providing a challenge for people that are more advanced.

What you can expect from us

*   Help and advice to achieve your personal fitness goals through planned progressional exercises and workouts. Though we will provide workouts, we encourage all members to share their knowledge and experiences surrounding fitness. Members are invited to write workouts for sessions and amend any workout to their own needs.Â 
    
*   Organised workouts 3Â times a week around the Lancaster University campus.
    
*   New workout ideas throughout the year.
    
*   If you ever want to come to just chill, that's fine.
    
*   Discrimination,Â harassment, and bullying will not be tolerated.Â 
    

If you have any questions please message us on ourÂ **[instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lu_fitnesssociety/)** or **[facebook page](https://www.facebook.com/LUSWAC).**

Membership options and pricing

You must have an active membership with our society to attend any of our sessions.

\- Free Taster membership - Gives you access to all our sessions for the first 2 weeks of Michaelmas term. This is a great opportunity to try out the society before committing to a full membership.

\- Â£5 Termly membership - Gives you access to all our sessions for an entire term.

\- Â£10 Yearly membership - Gives you access to all our sessions for the entire academic year.

There is no additional charge to attend any of our sessions as well as no requirement to have a gym membership.Â 

**[Join this group](https://lancastersu.co.uk/groups/fitness-society-95ce/join)**Â and follow the instructions to join us!

Please follow our **[instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lu_fitnesssociety/)** or **[facebook page](https://www.facebook.com/LUSWAC)** where we post updates and discussÂ workouts and events.

Our session times

Our **first** sessions of the term are:

Tuesday 10th October 6-7:45pm

name: Cricket - Men
description:
**Lancaster University Cricket Club** is a rapidly expanding clubÂ with aÂ strong and diverse membership base. WithÂ two very competitiveÂ BUCS teams, including ourÂ first XI, who play in BUCS Division 2A, and the second XI, who playÂ in BUCS Division 4A. Additionally, we haveÂ a ThirdÂ XI that competes atÂ Roses and in multiple friendlies during the summer months, against both other universities and local sides. This ensures thatÂ there's cricket for all levels of ability, experience and commitment.Â Welcoming cricket badgers from across the spectrum, LUCC is home to both high-class and beautifullyÂ villageÂ cricket; all rolled into our trademarkÂ brand of strokery!

We haveÂ three training sessions a week ensuring thatÂ there is no shortage of contact time. During the second half of lent term, we begin moving outside for fielding sessions to prepare us for the start of the season.Â Â In the summerÂ we move all our sessions to theÂ outdoor nets (weather permitting).Â 

LUCC hosts regular socials, drinking and non-drinking, helping to maintain anÂ excellent club atmosphere, so come along and get involved!Â

name: Film Society
description:
Love film? So do we! If you love to watch orÂ talk aboutÂ films, we're the society for you!

Here at Lancaster University Film Society we aim to create a friendly, relaxing place for any students interested in discovering new films, engaging with old classics, or engaging with a community built around our weekly screenings (voted for by you!), post-screening discussions, cinema socials, film marathons, themed nights out, quizzes, and anything else our members wish for us to put on. We meet every Tuesday at 7pm in the Margaret Fell LT for our weekly meetings, everybody is welcome.Â 

[Our Screenings from the 2022-23 Academic YearÂ can be found here.](https://boxd.it/iByL8)

Term 1 Schedule for 2023-24:  
Â 

1.  Intro week (the social network)
2.  Directorâ€™s Debuts
3.  Black Directors
4.  HorrorÂ Films
5.  Mystery Film
6.  Films about Stage productions
7.  European Cinema
8.  Anime Films
9.  Hangout Films
10.  Christmas Films

Our screenings our free to attend, but we charge a membership ofÂ Â£5 for the entire year which allows you to vote for our weekly film, and gain access to our Facebook and WhatsApp groups as well as cover for any snacks and miscellaneous purchases we use to enhance our socials.Â If you wish to try us out simply come to any of our Tuesday meetings and be sure to follow us on Instagram [here](https://www.instagram.com/lu_filmsoc/)!

If you've bought membership, you should get an email from us with an invitation to our facebook. If you haven't, then [please request to join through this link](https://www.facebook.com/groups/353364250455498),

See you guys soon,

Erin, Lily, Shayan, Vera, Mo

The Film Soc Exec (2023-24)

name: Rugby League
description:
Welcome toÂ Lancaster LynxÂ Rugby League.
=======================================

Here you will be able toÂ keepÂ up-to-date with training session times, social events and live match reports from our Facebook and InstagramÂ pages.

We go into the 2023-24Â season looking to build on a good performanceÂ last year, with aspirations of winning the league and cup. We also have aÂ Roses win record ofÂ 100%, one of few clubs at the university to holdÂ such a record.Â This university year, make the wise choice by joining Lancaster Lynx. Come find us at Freshers Fest. Donâ€™t believe it, Rugby League it!

**Training Times:**

*   **Monday 4-5:30pm on the 3G**
    
*   **Sunday 6-7:30pm on the 3G**
    
*   **Wednesday Afternoon Matches/ Training if it is a by-week**
    
*   **Weekly socials every Wednesday**
    

**ROSES RECORD**

**2007: Lancaster 70-4 York (Lancaster WIN)**

**2015: Lancaster 24-14 York (Lancaster WIN)**

**2016: Lancaster 56-10 York (Lancaster WIN)**

**2017: Lancaster 36-10 York (Lancaster WIN)**

**2018: Lancaster 64-20 York (Lancaster WIN)**

**2019: Lancaster 24-10 YorkÂ (Lancaster WIN)**

**100% Winning record for Lancaster**

Our Victorious Roses Squad 2019
-------------------------------

Over the next year, you'll hear a lot of other societies tell you why they're better than other societies. So this is where we tell you why you should join us:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*   **Great Sport**\- Rugby league is a fast, furious and skilful sport that emphasises the tries and intense defence that make it such a great spectator and participant sport. Here at Lancaster, we have a proud 50-year history of playing rugby league, culminating in our unbeaten Roses record.

*   **No previous experience required-**Â The great thing about Rugby League is it's easy to pick up. Many players come to us with little/no Rugby League experience and in some cases no Rugby experience at all. Regardless of experience, you're welcome to the club and hopefully you'll catch the Rugby League bug. In the past we have had experienced rugby league players, rugby union players, american footballers, hockey players and people who have never played sport before all join the club and play Roses for us.

*   **We get the mix right-**Â We understand that primarily you're here to get a degree and we respect that. If you can't play/train because of upcoming deadlines or exams, we ask nothing more than you let us know in advance so we can plan around it. The Lynx family also extends off the pitch with senior and ex players offering guidanceÂ and support for other members, especially freshers.Â Â 

*   **Old boys-**Â The highlight of the year for many of the current or old boys, and the envy of every toher society at uni, is our annual Old Boys event. We're very lucky to have great support from our Old Boys with players from as far back as the 60'sÂ keeping in check throughout the year and remaining active in the team. The Lynx being the second oldest club at the university boasts nearly 50 years of historyÂ withÂ a long list of achievementsÂ including multiple cup and league titles,Â withÂ players going onto represent regional students, England & GB students and even fullÂ international caps.

*   **Great Socials-**Â Sugarhouse DJ, Jack Sprigg, openly said we had the 'Best theme for a social' (our annual Phoenix Nights social). We have an official social every Wednesday but frequently organiseÂ meet-upsÂ which tend to take place in Fylde Bar. Team breakfasts also take place throughout the year before games and at the beginning of each term.Â This is a great way to get to know the rest of the team and helpsÂ you make friends for life. description:

**Welcome to Lancaster University Ballroom DanceSport Society (LUBDS) !!!**
===========================================================================

LUBDS offers professional lessons in Latin American and Ballroom dancing every Monday night, as well as competitions, socials, performances, and much more...

We have a thriving beginners team, ranking 4th in the UK in 2022, as well as an active casual dancer community, so no matter what you want to get out of joining the society we can promise you a fantastic experience! Our Novice+ couples are also highly successful with consistent finals at every competition including 1st and 2nd at Nationals.

Our annual events include our Charity Showcase, Roses, NUDC (AKA Northerns, where we compete against other Northern and Scottish universities), IVDC (AKA Nationals, a country-wide competition hosted at the Blackpool Winter Gardens), our Christmas dinner and dance, and handover meal.Â 

We pride ourselves on being an accessible society - you don't need a partner, ballroom gear, or any experience to get started. Our professionally taught lessons are reasonably priced at Â£5/hr with block discounts available, and competitions are available to all regardless of skill level.Â 

We can't wait to welcome you into team Lancaster!

name: Defying Dementia Student Society
description:
Defying Dementia is a campaign founded at the university; to support research into drugs and development relating to dementia and other neurodegenerative diseases. Our societyÂ works to support this campaign by hosting various fundraising events. Another of our aims is to make a more Dementia friendly campus by offering Dementia Friends sessions in conjunction with the Alzheimerâ€™s Society. We also offer several volunteering opportunities including the Bay Dementia Hub, Defying Dementia Charity Shop, Join Dementia Research (JDR), and the chance to volunteer within the Dementia ward at Lancaster hospital. Our volunteering opportunities are a fantastic way to gain experience and to try your hand at something you may not have previously had a chance to. We have now started to fund a six week summer internship for a student at Lancaster University to work in the labs. This will be an annual internship.Â 

Our society is also the proud winner of theÂ LUSU Fundraising and Volunteering Award 2022 and our previous President, Ffion won the LUSU Lasting Impact Award 2023 for her work with the Defying Dementia Student Society.Â

name: Cheerleading
description:
Welcome to the Lancaster Roses Cheerleading Squad!
==================================================

Cheerleading is a fun, competitive team sport that incorporates stunting, dance, jumps and gymnastics into an intense 2.5-minute routine. Â As a society, we train all year to compete at various regional and national championships against other university teams across the UK!Â 

Cheerleading is a physically demanding sport but is also a lot of fun and a great way to make friends, keep fit and represent the university at prestigious national competitions.Â  Our teams train twice a week for 2 hours throughout terms one and two in preparation for competitions as well as having weekly socials. This year we will have extra optional sessions for strength and fitness sessions.Â 

We welcome students of all abilities, whether you have cheered before, have a gymnastics or dance background, or have never tried it before, check out our video on our social media to see if cheerleading interests you!Â Most of our membersÂ are new to the sport but are trained in all aspects in order to develop their skills to reach their maximumÂ potential.

![May be an image of one or more people and people standing](https://scontent.fman4-2.fna.fbcdn.net/v/t39.30808-6/292255420_5259406597487935_1704577909547180346_n.jpg?_nc_cat=106&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=8631f5&_nc_ohc=UVM-QM04ZacAX9U37FJ&tn=XyQzRcGn1WNMa0pA&_nc_ht=scontent.fman4-2.fna&oh=00_AfCVMkvS2mozpmRIXjiFUcvBu1ZoFzjlrPpH8xWolHIP9w&oe=63742BFB)

The Lancaster Roses is comprised of 5Â squads; **1 development team,**Â **3 competitive stunt squads**Â and **1 competitive pom dance squad.**

**New Development Team**
------------------------

Our Development team **Rose Quartz**Â is open to anyone of all abilities to join and get involved with cheer**.**

**Stunt Squads**
----------------

Lancaster Roses is made up of 3 stunts squads;

*   **Pearl** (Level 1)
*   **Ruby** (Level 2 Co-ed)
*   **Onyx** (Level 3 Co-ed)

Our stunt squads, on the other hand, perform a combination of stunts, tumbles, jumps and dance. Each stunt group is combined of a single flyer, two bases and a back spot who work together to perform a variety of mounts and tosses. Each squad varies by level, with each level increasing the degree of difficultyÂ in the range of stunts and tumbles it incorporates.

**Pom Dance**
-------------

**Diamond** is our Co-EdÂ Pom Dance Squad. Pom danceÂ is a dance genre that incorporates a variety of dance skillsÂ into a fast-paced dynamic dance routine performed with poms. Â Characteristics of a pom routine includeÂ clean and precise motionsÂ and dance technique. Â Diamond has consistentlyÂ won their division at competitions, coming home with the National Champion title from BCA for the past 4Â years!

**Tumble, Stretch, and conditioning**
-------------------------------------

We also provide two weekly tumble, stretch, and conditioning sessions that are available to all members of the society to have fun and improve their skills. For those not in the society this class is a small fee of Â£2 for each session you attend!

What do we do?

Interested in finding out more about what we do? Head over to our social media and see what we have done and what to expect when you join the society. We will hopefully be having tryout sessions this year and encourage everybody to attent to see what the sport is like.

We hope you consider joining Lancaster Roses, please check out our social media:

**Facebook:**Â [https://www.facebook.com/LancasterRosesCheerSoc/](https://www.facebook.com/LancasterRosesCheerSoc/)

**Instagram:** @lancasterroses

Also, feel free to contact us atÂ **cheerleaders.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk**Â if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you throughout the year!

description: \*\*The Lancaster University Astronomy Society is perfect for anybody who loves space!\*\* \*\*We have regular observing nights (weather permitting), presentations, movie nights, socials, quizzes / game nights and more, all for FREE! We offer the opportunity to use a semi-professional observatory on the rooftop of the University's Physics Dept, with a 14" Schmidt-Cassegrain telescope, 11" Schmidt-Cassegrain telescope, a Coronado Solar H-alpha solar telescope, and lots more!\*\* \*\*We encourage you to bring your own kit if you have it! Whether you have never had any prior experience, have always wanted to have a go, or have always loved Astronomy like we do, this society will be a great opportunity to have a new perspective on the Universe and our home planet.Â  So sign up here to get email updates, join our \[discord\](https://discord.gg/pWtk7SRUww) and follow our \[Instagram\](https://www.instagram.com/luastrosoc/), \[Twitter\](https://twitter.com/luastrosoc), and other socials!\*\* \*\*We can't wait to meet you for the upcoming year!\*\* Join and learn to take photos like these: !\[\](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/434991/original/M31.jpeg)!\[\](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/434993/original/Needle.jpg)!\[\](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/434992/original/Bubble\_Nebula\_copy.jpg)

name: LUMAS - Manga and Anime
description:
### Hi there!

We're the Lancaster University Manga and Anime Society (often referred to as LUMAS), and we are a group with an interest in Japanese animation and manga, and act as a forum to bring together other fans, whether they be very new to anime or have had years of experience or anything in between. We screen a wide variety of different animated shows, including things fresh from the new season and older shows even non-anime fans may have heard of at our meetings. We aim to host three events a week, including watch sessions and socials!

* * *

### **Where and When?**

Every _Wednesday_, we meet from **2pm-5pm in Furness LT1**, and watch a variety of different anime based on a particular theme (such asÂ _Seinen, Romance_, Comedy,Â _Seasonals_, etc.). Over the past year, we have been conducting sessions with more broadly applicable themes, in an attempt to further improve the variety that this session brings to our members! These sessions in particular are extremely popular, and allow for a lot of discussion amongst the other members.

\---

Every _Saturday_, we meet from **2pm-5pm in Elizabeth Livingston Lecture Hall** and we watch a full show all the way through, voted on by the membership towards the start of the term. We usually juggle two shows concurrently, and we watch them over the course of around 4 weeks (but don't worry about missing one! We let you know exactly how far we get in each show every week, so it's easier to catch up with!). For Academic 2022/2023, we watched a number of highly-rated and well-regarded TV anime and films, including Vinland Saga, Black Lagoon, Samurai Champloo, Grand blue, Hinamatsuri!Â 

\---

Every other _Monday_, we meet from **7:30pm-9:30pm in Bowland North Seminar 6**, for a more actively creative type of session which we call _Manga Mondays_! We have our large manga library available for members to lend books such as _One Piece, Jujustu Kaisen_Â and _Attack On Titan_! In addition, we usually have a creative activity to do during these sessions that vary from week to week. In the past we have done scavenger hunt, quizzes, origami, and more! These sessions are great opportunity to get to know the other society members, and many current members consider these their most anticipated sessions! We generally hold a number of more competitive creative challenges throughout the course of the term during these sessions, and prizes in the past!

\---

Additionally, we hold a number of one-off events every year. In the past, these have included karaoke nights, film viewings (both on and off campus for movies such as Akira, A girl who leaped through time,Â _Redline, Perfect Blue,_ etc), karaoke, barbecues, bar crawls, scavengerÂ hunt and more! These socials occur every other week (alternating with Manga Mondays), so make sure you are a member so that you can recieve our weekly emails that let you know whichÂ events are happening during that week. Also included in the email is a weekly submission, createdÂ each week by one of our members, so if you're looking for reccommendations, artwork or bad LUMAS memesÂ there's no better place to start than there!

\---

With anime culture gaining more and more traction by the day with mainstream titles like _Chainsaw Man, Demon Slayer_Â andÂ _Attack on Titan_Â coming out more and more frequently, it's never been a better time to get in on the action! Membership is only Â£5.00 for the entire academic year (23/24), and becoming a memberÂ grants you access to all of our socials and our entire ever-expanding manga library. You can also get a free Temporary Membership, which will give you the same privileges as a Full Membership but will only last untilÂ start of Week 4.

* * *

### Find us on social media!

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/360348/original/lumachan.png)

*   [Discord](https://discord.gg/KKtMpNAUbP)
    
*   [Instagram](https://instagram.com/luanimesociety?igshid=MzRlODBiNWFlZA==)
    
*   [Facebook](http://www.facebook.com/LUMASAnime)
    
*   [Twitter](https://www.twitter.com/Luma_Chan_)
    
*   [Anilist](https://anilist.co/user/LUMAS/animelist)

name: American Football
description:
LANCASTER BOMBERS AMERICAN FOOTBALL

TASTER SESSION SATURDAY 7th/Sunday 8th 12pm-2pm

Bring boots, water and wear sports clothes!

Welcome to the Lancaster Bombers American Football Club! We compete in the BUCS Northern Division 2, along with the UCLanÂ Rams, Bangor MudDogs, Keele Crusaders, Edge Hill Vikings, Staffordshire StallionsÂ 

and York Centurion in the famous Roses event.

Whether you're an experienced player coming from the junior leagues or have never watched a game in your life, all are welcome - no knowledge of the rules, no problem. We are a mixed gender team andÂ have all different kinds of players with all body types, so we are sure that we can find a position that suits you!Â 

OurÂ family approach to football creates a long lasting community; with Sunday afternoons spent watching all of the games together and socials on a Wednesday.Â YouÂ will quicklyÂ get to know your teammates and these events are a nice break from football.

We've set up a prospective players group chat up (link above)Â as a way for you to register your interest for the 2023/24Â season. This will let you keep tabs on upcoming events such as rookie sessions, where you canÂ try your hand at the different positions in American Football, and answerÂ any questions you might have: football or non-football related!

**Membership**Â 

Our membership cost is Â£100 for the upcoming year, paid in two termly installments, Â£60Â in Michaelmas Term and the other Â£40 in Lent Term (Â£90 for single yearlyÂ payment).Â This payment will give you access to shoulder pads, lowers and a helmet as well as fully qualified coaches and kit forÂ training. All Sport Lancaster clubs that are a member of BUCS use the Sports Centre and their facilities, and have a lotÂ ofÂ club expenses paid for,Â so require aÂ _**Sport Lancaster+ Membership**_ this can be included in a **YEARLY**Â gym membership. This will be explaind by the executive committee, however, once you do have a Sport Lancaster+ Membership, you can join as many BUCS teams as you'd like!

name: University of Lancaster Music Society (ULMS)
description:
Welcome to the University of Lancaster Music Society, better known as ULMS! Weâ€™re a friendly and inclusive society and welcome anyone with an interest in playing and performing music!Â 

Started by the head of the Music Department in 1979, we now have a Big Band, Brass Band, Choir, Orchestra, String Group, Swing Group, Wind BandÂ and various â€˜small groupsâ€™- any member of ULMS can join any of the ensembles, with auditions only used for key seats.

If you want to play a certain instrument or style of music, or set up a band/ensemble that we donâ€™t already have, we can help you to do that! Our Small Groups Rep works with musicians to make sure they get the opportunity to play the music they want.

Besides the music, we also run various socials throughout the year. From our traditional annual socials, such as theÂ Carolling Bar Crawl and the Summer Term BBQ, we also run games nights and film nights for a more chilled out vibe.Â In addition, weÂ have an annual Christmas Ball and Summer Ball for a chance to dress up and have a classy night with friends!

Fancy learning an instrument? We have a Project Teach Music (PTM) scheme for those that want to learn an instrument at an affordable price, with ULMS membersÂ as the teachers! Our PTM Coordinator can help match you with a teacher to start your music journey.

We have lots to offer, so come join in the fun!Â 

Membership is open to all members of Lancaster University and its associated colleges and environs. If you would like any more information about us,Â you can email our Secretary on secretary@ulms.org.uk.Â 

We put on a number of concerts throughout the year, with our biggest being our annual â€˜Summer Showcaseâ€™ concert in the summer â€“ a chance for every ensemble to show what they can do, with a finale piece involving every member of the society. Each year thereâ€™s also a Christmas Concert, Concerto Concert, WindBrass Concert, and Choir & Small Groups Concert, and individual ensembles often set up and play their own gigs throughout the year.

For more information visit our website:Â [http://ulms.org.uk/](http://ulms.org.uk/)Â and our Facebook page:Â [https://www.facebook.com/iloveulms/](https://www.facebook.com/iloveulms/)

name: Wing Chun
description:

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/groups/luwingchun/)

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lancasterwingchun/)

**_What is Wing Chun?_**

Wing Chun is a style of southern Chinese martial arts. It relies on scientific principles and experimentation in order to train, with the goal of learning effective self-defence. It is a striking art, with a focus on control and close-combat.

One of our core principles as a martial art is fighting in the most efficient way possible, while still staying safe; the process of experimentation we use allows us to do this, and lets people tailor their style to what works best for them.

**_Iâ€™m smaller/weaker than average, can I still learn?_**

Since Wing Chun was originally invented and tailored by a woman, the martial art is designed specifically with smaller people in mind. While it can still be learnt and practiced by taller people, they are not necessarily at an automatic advantage as they might be in other martial arts.

Wing Chun also uses a more relaxed style of fighting, so while strength can be useful, the martial art focuses on taking advantage of speed and dexterity over brute force.

**_Do you have Weapons training?_**

Wing Chun traditionally makes use of two weapons, the Butterfly Swords and the Longpole.

While we do not yet have any equipment for weapons training, we are hoping to purchase some this coming year, so it is likely we will be introducing training for Butterfly Swords. Since Wing Chun is focused on self-defence, and weapons build upon unarmed combat,Â theyÂ are usually only taught at a higher level.

**_How much does it cost?_**

Your first session at the society is free. After this, the training sessions costÂ Â£3 a week or Â£20 per term.

If you have any questions about this, please ask.

  
**_Anything else I should know before joining?_**

If you can, you should wear loose clothing, and bring some drinking waterÂ with you.

For more up to date news, please visit our Facebook page:

[https://www.facebook.com/groups/1657967527754921/](https://www.facebook.com/groups/1657967527754921/)

Or our Instagram page:

Â [https://www.instagram.com/lancasterwingchun/](https://www.instagram.com/lancasterwingchun/)

name: Criminology Society (@lucrimsoc)
description:
Lancaster University Criminology Society is an inclusive academic and social community for students who have an interest in all things Criminology, True CrimeÂ & Criminal Justice. We work alongside the Law School and other LUSU societies to bring our members a wide variety of events, ranging from academic and career informed activities that complement existing criminology knowledge, to fun and social nights designed to help foster a strong sense of community. Our society is NOT exclusive to those studying Criminology :)

This year, we have merged with LU True Crime Society (@lutruecrime) to create a bigger and better society, open to all those with a love for true crime and criminology. Our regular CrimSoc social events will be held alongside new true crime case discussion and unsolved mystery evenings - doubling the number of events available to our members. name: Taekwondo
description:
Taekwondo is a Korean martial art with an emphasis on flexibility and kicks. We teach traditional Taekwondo as well as street self-defence against a variety of techniques (including knife attacks), fitness, Olympic-style sparring, and much more. There is an optional grading test at the end of every term, allowing you to progress through the belt system. You could be approaching black belt by graduation!Â 

Joining Taekwondo is a great opportunity and a relaxedÂ environmentÂ to build self-confidence, get in shape, learn how to defend yourself and meet new friends. We compete round the county against universities across the UK which is a great opportunity to test your skills and make friends with other taekwondo practitioners! We have regular socials such as meals, cinema trips and an annual Mario Kart competition.Â 

No prior martial arts experience is needed - we actively encourage complete beginners to join! We have sessions led every Wednesday evening by professional instructor:Â Sam Ellison 4th Dan and 1st Dan in kickboxing,Â as well as exec-run sessions on Sunday afternoons to complement these.

name: Model United Nations
description:
The Lancaster University Model United Nations Society (LancsMUN) helps you get involved with global issues by simulatingÂ UN organs and other forums of international relations where you take the role of a country's representative.Â   
  
MUN simulates UN conferences and aims to build an understanding of global challengesÂ that crosses borders of background, culture and nationality.  
Our society teaches you the art of diplomacy and debating and helps you to prepare for conferences across the UK and beyond.

OurÂ sessions are usually every Tuesday, and we run sessions in person or via Teams.

Memberships willÂ be open for sign-up by our first session.

name: Lancaster Go club
description:
The **Lancaster Go club** is a friendly community of Go players living in Lancaster and whom first started gathering over 2 decades ago and, despite the coming and going of multiple members has been almost uninterruptedly going on ever since providing a point of connection between Lancaster and the rest of Go players all over the UK.

 Lancaster Go Club ABOUT USRULESJOSEKLEMORE Aggressive mode

Do you like strategy games, intellectual challenges, complex patterns build from easy rules? Then Go is the game for you!  
Go (also known as _baduk_, _igo_ or _weiqi_) is a 2 player abstract strategy game believed to be the oldest continuously played game in human history.  
Go is known for having very simple rules that contrast with its extreme complexity (it takes under 5 minutes to learn the rules and a lifetime to master the game).

Whether you are a complete beginner or a dan player the Lancaster Go club offers a friendly and relaxing environment to play and study Go.

name: Karate
description:
Lancaster University Karate Club
================================

Learning karate is a great way to improve physical fitness and learn self-defence. We always welcome new members, so come along and try it out. The first two sessions are free!

Lent Term Training Times:
-------------------------

Tuesdays, 8-9.40 pm, Traditional (Mixed), Brandrigg Room

Thursdays, 8-9.40 pm, Competition Karate, Library Foyer

Fridays, 6-7.20 pm, Traditional (Beginners), Brandrigg Room

Fridays, 7.30-8.50 pm, Traditional (Advanced), Brandrigg Room

Memberships:
------------

Yearly membership: Â£45.00\*

Termly membership: Â£25.00

Session fee (non-members): Â£3.00

\*Yearly memberships run until the end of the academic year

Please make payments to the following bank bank account (please include your name in the reference):

Name: Lancaster University Karate Club

Account Number: 70138563

Sort Code: 30-98-97.

Alternatively, payments can be made in cash.

----------

President - Everett Elmy

Vice President - Emmi Wilson

Social Secretary - Ewan McManus

Men's Team Captain - Cameron Proctor

Women's Team Captain - Maddy Ball

Contact Us:
-----------

Like us on Facebook: [www.Facebook.com/LancasterKarate](http://www.Facebook.com/LancasterKarate)

Follow us on Instagram @LancsKarateClub

name: Architecture Society
description:
**Welcome toÂ luarcsoc, Lancaster University Architecture Society!**Â 

Whether you are studying architecture or simply interested in building design, then you should join our society. We hostÂ a wide variety of **socials**, such as pub quizzes,Â cake-building challenges and bowling.Â 

As a society, we aim to connect all year groups and to support people with their work. Therefore, we offer a **student peer mentoring scheme**. An opportunity for first-year students to ask any questions directly to the years above,Â 

We also offer **ARCHIextras**, which areÂ regular talks/events hosted byÂ students orÂ external speakers.Â 

**Follow our socials to keep up-to-date with the society:**

name: Chinese Students & Scholars Association (CSSA)
description:
The Lancaster University Chinese Students and Scholars Association (LUCSSA) is supported by the Education Section of the Chinese Embassy of the Peopleâ€™s Republic of China,it isÂ a non-political, non-religious and non-profit organization, which organizesÂ and supports various social and cultural activities among Chinese students and scholars in Lancaster. Anyone is welcome, whether Chinese or those with an interest in the Chinese culture.

Every year LUCSSAÂ holds a diverse variety of eventsÂ from sports, entertainment and culture oriented events to academic or career related workshops, aiming toÂ improveÂ the lives of the Chinese students here in LancasterÂ as well as promote the exchange of Sino-British culture. Anyone who is interested in chinese culture is welcome to join us.

name: LULego
description:
**LULEGO** is the society for fans of everything Lego, Lego GamesÂ &Â Stop-motion Animation. Since the accidental creation of the Lego brick in 1958, Lego has created endless imaginative joy for people of all ages. The beauty of Lego is wherever you are from, or whatever language you speak, you will know and enjoy building with the bricks.Â 

  
As a society we meet every Tuesday at 7pm in Bowland NorthÂ SR 07Â to host sessions for members to create whatever they want with our Lego collection. We have themed events each week such as building competitions, lego games, group build andÂ stop-motion animation. More information can be found on our Facebook page. One of the best things about Lego is the massive number of brands that now have Lego sets. For this reason, we love to collaborate with other societies to really allow everyone to enjoy Lego.

For the academic year 2023Â â€“ 2024, the LULEGO Exec Team includes;

*   President - Jack Nettleton
*   Treasurer - George Ford
*   General Secretary - Eleanor Maddock
*   Social Secretary - Aidan Bohan
*   Storage Secretary - Will Dickson

Membership is FREE, so sign up now and drop-in to one of our events!

**OUR SESSION TIMES**

Tuesday, 19:00-21:00 Bowland North SR7

Check out [our Facebook page](https://www.facebook.com/LULEGOofficial/),Â [our Twitter account](https://twitter.com/LULEGOofficial), [our Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lancasterlego/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=)Â and [our Discord](https://discord.gg/Fms8Y3Ztzn)Â for event confirmation

Stay tuned for more events!

name: Sailing
description:
We are Lancaster University Sailing Club (LUSC). We sail throughout the year at Bolton Sailing Club and welcome everyone whether you're a novice or an expert. Transport is organised by the club leaving from campus for each session.Â 

We runÂ start sailing courses over the course of the year,Â perfect forÂ those who want to learn, or just have fun on the water. All transport, equipment and tuition isÂ included in the price.Â Sessions are held on Sundays, check our instagram for details (@lancssailing). You'll be taught by experienced and qualified instructors and safety team, who can answer any questions you might have on the day.

Lancaster University Sailing Club also focuses on team racing, which involves three boats on three, in a short, tenseÂ battle. We train on Saturdays,Â aiming to qualify for the BUSA University Finals, whereÂ last year we managed to finish in the top 15.Â We also competeÂ againstÂ universities in weekend long events,Â involving both sailing and social events.

We hostÂ regular themed socials, in addition toÂ our Christmas Dinner "LUSCmas", Roses and Final Fling.Â

name: Lancaster University Russian Speaking Society
description:
Privet! Hi, Friends!Â 

We are a Russian SpeakingÂ Society of Lancaster University! The aim of the society is to bring all amazingÂ Russian speakers studying at Lancaster together!Â 

We love DELICIOUS FOOD andÂ FRIENDLY ENVIRONMENT. We are trying to spread our culture and share it with the rest of the world because it's simply great ;)

We are holding a lot ofÂ amazing events which are mainly culture-related, but more importantly food-related :)Â 

If you are interested in the Russian Language and the background of people who can speak it, you are more than welcome to join our society and will not regret it for a minute!

Here is the link to our social media, where you can find more information about our society:

https://linktr.ee/LURSS

We organise meetings every Thursday, 8 pm in the Grizedale Common Room.Â Also, we would love to add that our society is multicultural and international, so please, join us! See you soon!

name: Cricket - Women
description:

**Welcome to Lancaster University Women's Cricket Club!**

We are a close-knit, friendly and enthusiastic group of girls, who train hard and love a social.Â 

We welcome new and experienced players from all backgrounds, with no kit needed, so don't worry if you have never picked up a bat before, we will be more than happy to teach you the ropes. For our more experienced players, we will look to help you improve your skills further and support you in your development as a cricketer.Â 

In the summer we play in the nationwide BUCS leagueÂ in the Women's Northern Tier 1 (1B)Â division, and most importantly, in the famous ROSES tournament against York. #ROSESARERED

Our club has a strong sense of community, with regular socials organised for team bonding, from the classicÂ Wednesday sport social nights, to cozy quiz nights, you will quickly feel at home with the team.

Look forward to seeing you at training! :)

name: Women in Business
description:
**Welcome to Lancaster University Women in Business (LUWIB)!**

Lancaster Universityâ€™s Women in Business Society aims to support and encourage ambitious and aspiring womenÂ by helping to improve their business skills and consequently, their career prospects. Through our events, we aim to help increase understanding of business and entrepreneurship, introduce members to the vast variety of opportunities available to them during and after university, and improve a range of important skills, such as networking and commercial awareness.

We also run a weekly newsletter highlightingÂ the upcoming opportunities for students to get involved in which could be anything from university-based schemes and virtual careers fairs to internships and graduate roles.Â This year, we are also proud to announce our new sponsors Lloyd's Banking Group, and ourÂ new partnersÂ GAIN- Girls Are Investors!

**Our event series currently include:**

*   **Intro to Industries -**This series consists of speaker and panel events with a workshop element to interactively introduce our members to each industry and walk them through what employment in this area resembles daily.
*   **Employability sessions-** These sessions target the specific skills that will drastically increase employability as a new graduate such as CV, interview, and internship assessment support sessions.
*   **Self-growth sessions-** Our self-growth series aims to aid personal development through our membersâ€™ university years. With a less academic focus, this enables our members to network with peers and develop healthy habits. We also make sure to utilise and raise awareness of university schemes and support through these sessions.
*   **Girls night sessions-** We also host informal gathering events with an emphasis on creating a safe and inclusive space for all women to enjoy some time away from academia.

Join us by clicking on:

*   [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lancasteruni_wibsoc/)Â 
*   [LinkedIn](http://linkedin.com/company/lancaster-university-women-in-business-society)

Current Opportunities:

*   **Career Opportunities with PwC:**Â From exciting summer internship opportunities to their 11-month-long undergraduate work placements, explore PwC Undergraduate and Graduate opportunitiesÂ [here](https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.careersstudent.pwc.co.uk%2Fjob-search%2F&data=05%7C01%7Cwomeninbusiness.su%40groups.lancaster.ac.uk%7C2fd532e8bc4e4c97b94808dbe054a3db%7C9c9bcd11977a4e9ca9a0bc734090164a%7C0%7C0%7C638350426358068175%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=JWk%2FetxMg2Ya7CBs08sdQxT3Y22s6JfUlfqNVr3QqBU%3D&reserved=0 "Original URL: https://www.careersstudent.pwc.co.uk/job-search/. Click or tap if you trust this link.")
*   **Networking with PwC:**Â Across the year, PwC will be hosting a number of events in their new Virtual Park as well as office-based which will allow you to find out more about the company, specific business areas, and wider topics such as sustainability at PwC.Youâ€™ll also be able to have one-on-one conversations with their business ambassadors and members of their Student Recruitment team. Register for an eventÂ [here](https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fjobs.pwc.co.uk%2Fstudent%2Fuk%2Fen%2Fevents%3Futm_source%3Duk_rec_ukcareers_website_student%26utm_medium%3Dstudent_event_search%26utm_campaign%3Dearly_careers_events%26utm_term%3Dfy24&data=05%7C01%7Cwomeninbusiness.su%40groups.lancaster.ac.uk%7C2fd532e8bc4e4c97b94808dbe054a3db%7C9c9bcd11977a4e9ca9a0bc734090164a%7C0%7C0%7C638350426358068175%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ilOkrxHupJfUSKLiiRTJF%2FMHfvv%2Fnb7GuLwIMghcm1M%3D&reserved=0 "Original URL: https://jobs.pwc.co.uk/student/uk/en/events?utm_source=uk_rec_ukcareers_website_student&utm_medium=student_event_search&utm_campaign=early_careers_events&utm_term=fy24. name: Welsh Society
description:
Full Description:

Although there are many sheep in the fields around campus, like everyone else, Welsh students can find it hard to truly feel at home at university. Weâ€™ve all been there, and Lancaster University Welsh Society is here to help! name: CompSoc
description: Lancaster University Computer Science Society exists to promote interest in computing and technology among students and wider society. Social and educational events are run every week, with beginner and advanced topics to cover a wide variety of interests. See our events for more information.

name: Lancaster Nightline
description:
Lancaster Nightline is a confidential listening and information service run by students, for students at Lancaster University. We aim to provide a night-time contact point offering a wealth of free information and a non-judgemental listening ear. All calls made to us are confidential, and remain completely anonymous. No matter if youâ€™re stressed about workload, having family or friendship problems, need help getting back from The Sugarhouse or simply want a chat, Lancaster Nightline is here to listen, you can contact us through phone calls,Â instant messaging or email.

You can also [volunteer with us](https://lancaster.nightline.ac.uk/volunteer-with-us/) on as a call taker, or as a publicity team member, bothÂ with full training provided.

Find us at [https://lancaster.nightline.ac.uk/](https://lancaster.nightline.ac.uk/)  
Instagram: @lancasternightline

name: Sikh Society
description:
**About:**

This society was created by Sikhs at Lancaster dedicated towards education and awareness about Sikhi, and to provide a community for Sikhs on campus. We are open to **all**, regardless of religion and whether you are religious yourself. We regularly have events, including Gurdwara Trips (Sikh place of worship), discussionsÂ and socials that are **non-alcoholic and vegetarian friendly**. There are a variety of ages of students in the society, and we encourage both undergraduate and postgraduate students to join. This is a safe space and a tight-knit community, and we are always excited to welcome new people to our community.

**Connect with us on Social Media:**

**Instagram:** [@lancaster\_sikhsoc](https://www.instagram.com/lancaster_sikhsoc/)

**E-mail:**Â sikhsoc.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk

name: Lancaster University Junior Lawyers Against Poverty
description:
The Lancaster University Junior Lawyers Against Poverty Society was founded in 2021Â and is the Lancaster branch of the national Lawyers Against Poverty (LAP) student initiative. The aim of the initiative is to not only encourage on-campus student involvement in human rights, access to justice and international development but also create a internationalÂ network of students and junior lawyers working to eradicate poverty through improving access to justice and legal education globally.Â 

At Lancaster we incorporate these aims by providing students the opportunity to get involved in activities, projects and events that aim to raise awareness of issues relating to human rights, access to justice, and international development. Some of the opportunities we offer include:

*   LUJLAP Legal Design Project
*   LUJLAP Podcast
*   LUJLAP Fundraising Team
*   LUJLAP Blog Team
*   The ILBF Legal Textbook Exchange
*   Collaborations with local charities to offer volunteering to LUJLAP members.Â 
*   Fundraising events for the LAP Justice Fund (a fund that contributes to supporting legal aid clinics and public interest litigation projects around the world)
*   Conferences, panel discussions, and Q&A Events on contemporary legal issues
*   Social Events
*   Inter-University Competitions (Essay, Mooting, Negotiations etc)

So, whether you are interested in meeting like minded people at university, taking part in exciting social justice projects, or looking to secure a career in human rights or international development, the Lancaster University Junior Lawyers Poverty Society is the ideal society to join.Â 

If you have any questions, or want to find out more about us and our work, then do not hesitate to get in touch either through our website or via our social media pages linked below.Â 

*   **Facebook**:Â https://www.facebook.com/LancasterJLAP
*   **Instagram**:Â https://www.instagram.com/lancaster\_jlap/
*   **Twitter**:Â https://twitter.com/JlapLancaster
*   **Website**:Â https://lancasterjlap.wixsite.com/my-site

name: Take2Cinema
description:
**Welcome to Take2Cinema!**

We'reÂ Lancaster University's ONLYÂ on-campus cinema and the oldest society on campus!Â We're fully equipped with a digital cinema projector and 7.1 DolbyÂ surround sound, allowing you to experience the film at its best.Â 

You'll be able to come and visit us every week fromÂ Friday to Monday (with subtitled screenings on Fridays and Saturdays\*), but keep an eye out on our social media for any special events we may be holding throughout the term. You'll also be able to find up to date schedules for the term on our website and socials!Â Doors will open at 7:15pmÂ and the movie will start at 7:30 pm, giving you plenty of time to purchase refreshments and get comfy before the main event!Â We show new releases alongside older classics, giving you the chance to see your favourites in the cinema again. Standard ticket price is Â£4.50, making us the cheapest cinema tickets available in Lancaster!

Wanting to joinÂ us?Â We are always looking for more projectionists and potential exec members! If you are interested just have a chat with us at one of our showings or contact us on social media or through our website!Â 

\*where available

**Contact Information:**

*   Instagram: @take2lancaster
*   Website: take2.lancastersu.co.uk
*   Email: take2cinema@lancaster.ac.uk
*   Address: Bowland Main LT,Â Lancaster University

name: Edible Campus
description:
### **About**

Edible Campus is at its core an experiment in community farming. As a society weÂ aimÂ toÂ create an environment where students can learn, teach and exchange ideas about small-scale farming and sustainable practices. Working with GreenLancaster, we work to use sustainable, wholesome and effective practices to grow our garden.

The majority of work at EcoHub involves garden maintenance. We plan, plant and harvest our garden year-round and student volunteers are the keyÂ component that keeps the project alive. With numerous raised beds, a polytunnel, wildlife pond,Â and orchard we have a diversity of interests for you to engage in. We sell our produce at Central, the Farmer's Market in Alexandra Square, and we do Seasonal Veg Boxes over the summer. We also make jams and preserves out of the produce harvested at the EcoHub.

_At ourÂ core, we want to give students the fundamental skills to build their own sustainable practices._

### **Learn more**

To find out more about who we are, what we do, and how you can get involved, visitÂ our info page below.

**Edible Campus Info Page -** [https://ediblecampussu.wixsite.com/website](https://ediblecampussu.wixsite.com/website)

### **Find us on social media**

Follow us on social media for news and updates.

**Facebook -**Â  [https://www.facebook.com/ediblecampusLU/](https://www.facebook.com/ediblecampusLU/)

**Instagram -**Â  [https://www.instagram.com/ediblecampuslu/](https://www.instagram.com/ediblecampuslu/)

name: Belly Dancing Society
description:
![LUBELLS - Lancaster University Belly Dancing Society ](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/468878/original/LUBBELLs_Title_and_Photo.PNG)

**Welcome to Lancaster University Belly Dancing Society(LUBells)!!!**

LUBells is a small society whichÂ offers weekly bellydance lessons with an experienced teacher as well as fun socials and performance opportunities.

Our lessons are open to dancers of all abilitiesÂ andÂ don't requireÂ any special clothes or equipment, so just wear something comfortable that you are able to shimmy in!Â Since belly dance is aÂ  low-impact yet dynamicÂ style of dance, it isÂ a great way to keep fit, improving core strength, muscle tone and flexibility whilst being easily adaptable to accomodate anyÂ accessability needs.

Each term, weÂ introduce newÂ belly dance styles, music and props to master in time for various performances throughout the year. Performing is completely optional but its a great opportunity toÂ get dressed up (in gorgeousÂ costumes provided by the society), show off your movesÂ and take some brilliant photos!

So what are you waiting for, join LUBells today to learn the beautiful art of bellydance!

**Classes:**

**6:30-7:30 every Tuesday in Brandrigg room** (Barker House Farm, South West Campus)

Â£2 individual lesson fee (FIRST LESSON FREE!)

**OR** Â£10 termly lesson blockÂ payment

**OR**Â Â£20 annual lesson block payment

\+ Â£5 Annual membershipÂ 

For more information, click the icons below to visit our social media pages or visit our website:Â [https://lubells.webs.com/](https://lubells.webs.com/)

If you have any questions, feel free to message us on any of our social media or drop us an email at **bellydancing.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk!**Â

name: Underwater Hockey
description:
Underwater Hockey (UWH) is aÂ limited-contact sport in which two teams compete to manoeuvre a puck across the bottom of a swimming pool into the opposing team's goal. Whilst it was found in England in the 1950s, it is now popular all over the world, especially in countries like Austrailia, New Zealand, andÂ Canada!

We are aÂ friendlyÂ team who play competitively and for fun. We welcome everyone of all abilities, from complete beginners to seasoned professionals, you're sure to enjoy being part of our society! Most of our members have never played before, some haven't even heard of the sport, but once you try it you won't want to give it up. We play and compete as a mixed sex team. A gym membership is not needed.

As well as regular training sessions we hold a variety of socials. As the game is based underwater it's hard to socialise with the team in training, so we make an effort to get together above water and often hold socials ranging fromÂ nights out, team meals, trips, and chilled nights in.

Come and give it a go...Â you won't regret it!

description:

name: LGBTQ+ Forum
description:
As a group we aim to be as diverse, inclusive, and accepting as possible. We are a Students Union Subcommittee who operate a Forum, not a society â€“ we do not have a membership list nor do we charge a fee of any kind.

The LGBTQ+ Forum exists to promote LGBTQ+ equality within the student community and, where possible, on a wider scale. We strive to make all of our events and meetings â€˜safeÂ spacesâ€™ â€“ this means that they are completely confidential, and we never publicise who attends without asking their permission. Respecting that safe space is our highest priority, as we want to ensure anyone coming into a meeting feels comfortable there.

We have weeklyÂ Monday coffee evenings where you can chat with new people over a cup of tea or coffee. We also run regular socials, campaigns, and other events. Weâ€™d love to see you at any of our meetings or events, so youâ€™re always welcome to come along!

For all of our social media and links look at our current links page [**here**](https://lancastersu.co.uk/groups/lgbtq-forum/pages/current-links).  
We also have a discord server which we use as a group chat and to advertise events for the forum. If you would like to join message any of our social media accounts for a link.

name: Table Tennis
description:
Welcome toÂ Lancaster University Table Tennis Club!

If you've previously played some table tennis and you're looking to join a fun sports club then LUTTC is a great club to be a part of. We have a developement session on Monday 8-10, and BUCS sessions Monday 8:15-9:45 and Tuesday 6:45-8:15. We have 2 Men's BUCS teams and 1Â Women's BUCS team, all of which are competitive. On top of this, we have fiveÂ open teams competitng in the Lancaster and Morecambe Table Tennis League, with A and B team in the Premier Division, and C,Â D and E team in the Champsionship Division.Â We hope you join us at LUTTC and we're looking forward to an exciting and special year ahead.

If you are after a more casual experience, please get involved in the college league! See your JCR Sports Rep for more information.

Please follow our social media accounts for all the up to date information and all things LUTTC!

[www.facebook.com/luttc](http://www.facebook.com/luttc)

[https://www.instagram.com/lutabletennis/](https://www.instagram.com/lutabletennis/)

name: Lancaster University Philosophy Society
description:
**ABOUT US**

Lancaster University Philosophy Society, also known as 'philsoc', is the perfect place for anyone interested in philosophy! Whether you're a current Philosophy student, enjoy looking into the subject as a hobby, or are completely new to the world of philosophy, this is the society for you!Â We discuss a broad rangeÂ of philosophical topics at our discussions including: metaphyiscs,Â philosophy of mind, aesthetics, epistemology, politics, philosophy of language, personal identity, ethics, religion, and art. WeÂ hope to prompt interesting new discussions in a safe and positive environment, and we'd love for you to join us.

**EVENTS**Â 

Balancing the academic with the social, philsocÂ plays host to an array of events that anyone can attend. From our weekly discussion sessions, toÂ monthly guest lectures by leading academics, termly collaborations with other societies, and a wide range of socials throughout the yearÂ we try to cater to everyone's philosophical interests!

We are also the perfect place to find likeminded individuals and fellow students who may be able to help you with any academic struggles you might be facing, from helping to understand complex content to essay writing skills and advice.

**MEMBERSHIP**

An annual membership to philsoc is Â£5 and includes access to all our discussions, socials and guest speaker events, as well as 15% off our merchandise!

However your first session is always free, so please come along and give us a try!

**SOCIAL MEDIA**

We organise a lot of our events through Instagram and Facebook. So follow us over atÂ [@lu\_philsoc](https://www.instagram.com/lu_philsoc/)Â on Instagram, like our [Facebook Page](https://www.facebook.com/LancasterUniversityPhilosophySociety/?ref=aymt_homepage_panel&eid=ARAtkvJ5OxQJEbYYu1ATPRb_aY42t7mUe7rKm2I3p7smKYODbAWYv8uk49IPVpd-qiWfQ4PsR3RNYwk7)Â and request to join our [Facebook Group](https://www.facebook.com/groups/2209282175/?source_id=112879506043174)Â to keep up-to-date with philsocÂ news and events.

name: SCAN
description:
**S Â  Â C Â  Â  A Â  Â  N**

STUDENT COMMENT AND NEWS

est. 1967

**Your** **student** **voice. Your student newspaper.**

**[www.scan.lancastersu.co.uk](http://www.scan.lancastersu.co.uk/)**

**WHO ARE _WE_?**

\- Student Comment and News (SCAN) was established in 1967, making it one of the _longest-running student publications_ in Europe.

\- It is a paper run by students for students. It is your space to write about the topics and issues you feel strongly about!

\- We _publish a print issue every term_ and have opportunities for you to get involved as a **writer**, **photographer**, **editor**, **illustrator** and much more.

\- We are an _award-winning_ paper! Being shortlisted for Best News Story at the SPA (Student Publication Awards) in 2019 and being shortlisted for Best Publication atÂ SPA in 2021. In 2023, we won **2nd Best Sport Section** in the whole UK and Northern Ireland!

**_WHY_ GET INVOLVED?**

\- Build a portfolio of work, from written articles or photography, to gain experience in the media and creative industry.

\- Make friends with like-minded people outside of your course or college.

\- Sharpen your writing skills, write in your style, and use your voice.

\- Write across many different sections such as:Â News,Â Comment, Lifestyle, Arts & Culture, Screen, Music, Creative Writing, and Sport.

**HOW DO I GET _INVOLVED_?**

\- Follow the link below to head to the Student's Union Societies page. It's only Â£8 to join for the whole year!

\- Also, you don't need to have experience to join!Â 

\- Alternatively, email [scan.editor@lancastersu.co.uk](mailto:scan.editor@lancastersu.co.uk) with any questions.

name: LA1TV
description:
Are you interested in getting involved with an award winning station that is widely respected amongst students? From Management, to Software Development, to Production, LA1TV offer you the chance to get involved and contribute in any way!

With access to professional equipment and software, you can be involved in high quality productions or, if you have your own ideas, show them off to the world!

If you aren't sure, the first 3 weeks of term are FREE to attend - from training sessions to full production livestreams. That means potentially being in a show for FREE before joining as a member. If you are intrigued by this but are still unsure, drop us a message on Facebook and we will be more then happy to help as best we can!

Opportunities
Throughout the academic year, we provide our members with many opportunities to get involved with. These range from livestreaming events for societies, to our live coverage of Roses, to the production of recap videos for the end of year college extravs (which we can provide limited entry for).

In between all the major events, there are plenty of other things to do. These include but are not limited to:

Livestreams
Studio Shows
Commisisons
Event Coverage
Due to LA1's prestige we are able to get a hold of press passes for many on campus events and even some off campus ones too, such as Highest Point. Not only will you be invovled in local student events, but potentially big official commercial ones too!

But what if you want to make a weekly show or maybe even revise during exam season? Well, LA1 provides even this with our members only exclusive area. This can be found just behind Go Burrito (under Spar) in the Slaidburn House building. Here, we have a control room, studio and office space for our members to use. Not only is it a great place to escape, but most of what the campus has to offer is within easy walking distance!

Whether you want to be in front or behind the camera, there are so many ways to get involved with LA1TV: Directing, Presenting, Producing, Camera Operating, Graphic Design, Video Editing, Publicity, Acting, Script Writing and so much more! If there is something you think we should have but we don't, then we need you!

Remember, if you have any more questions you can message our Facebook, come around to our office or send us an email at contact@la1tv.co.uk Hope to have you on board soon!
