**Session Times for Michealmas Term:**

*   6-8pm Wednesday
*   4-6pm Sunday with Muay Thai

Â Â ![Image preview](https://attachments.office.net/owa/l.gillett1%40lancaster.ac.uk/service.svc/s/GetAttachmentThumbnail?id=AAMkADY0NTVlMTE3LWQ2MmQtNGQ1OC04Y2UyLTA2YmRjZGI3YzdkYQBGAAAAAACaK1rPbJPPT6iGexFVo3ycBwDhBQmAUCIBQI1pt3VSkGtdAAAAAAEMAADhBQmAUCIBQI1pt3VSkGtdAAEF%2FzWtAAABEgAQAKRe5lyb52VAlWVQrD20tDk%3D&thumbnailType=2&token=eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsImtpZCI6IjczRkI5QkJFRjYzNjc4RDRGN0U4NEI0NDBCQUJCMTJBMzM5RDlGOTgiLCJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJ4NXQiOiJjX3VidnZZMmVOVDM2RXRFQzZ1eEtqT2RuNWcifQ..S-KAoV_VoNb7E6aBnJjBBG3MX_YSWirKxbMIoy_gcFhuHDLYtMssviCSrl2zdNx94ibRLLXSabFI62rwv2DteKpoMk1EvePnJ1WW69t6rzCsFcd5k6IF3sHzEVy4NW9wz6o8hSnvBxpxgKyCC4rt_84oEIWb9kpe4kaTD-00IqhhBETTaCuU8zET8aYiITw6kT_VcUkLUFdlCXSnZBFDAOSglkAQZjV6F1oBD0LE9oRHt6sMSJ-RQKDhI8cvozZBKmU90dMfBC9sGsbP1T_DmS4lAyfHX7oaAo68R3cWwQFvDCbsN5BO2GOR8E06kgtJoDTRH2BdXBoai-RerDAI2g&X-OWA-CANARY=j0wr-A4zL0yhIHBbsHp8PBAJ6HxWxNsY9Ejg3G5vaLR1uPixicuaU3QlxHIccFEoJLvV1yWRUf0.&owa=outlook.office365.com&scriptVer=20230922005.16&animation=true)

**Why Kickboxing?**

Kickboxing is one of the most versatile combat sports in the world, with a variety of traditional and modern forms. In the society, we prefer not to follow any one particular style, instead absorbing techniques from Karate, Taekwondo, Dutch and Thai styles in order to create a perfect blend for competitive success. Come to one or all of our 3Â  weekly taught sessions to develop new skills, enjoy a friendly atmosphere, a satisfying workout, and become a badass along the way. Want to do your own thing, use the equipment or spar with a buddy? We have weekend open-mat sessions you can come along to and train for a fouth time in the week.

**Beginner?**

We cater to all ability levels and people of all martial arts backgrounds, so do not hesitate to join us for a session.Â  During Michelmas term we have weekly sessions that are especially for beginners who may have never done any contact sport before or help people with experience in another martial art transfer their skills to Kickboxing. But don't be afraid to come to one of our sessions at any time of the year as we are always happy to teach someone new and there are always plenty of others in the same boat as you.Â 

**No equipment?**

Don't worry! We have everything you need, from gloves to shin guards and headgear.

**Got the competitive itch?**

We attend a national university competition hosted by Leeds University, the biggest of it's kind in the UK.

**Do I need a Uni Gym membership?**

No, we will never require our members to have a gym membership, even if they decide to compete.Â 

**Socials?**Â 

Yes, we do socials! We aim for at least three a term, with one being sober (such as pizza or sultans)

![Image preview](https://attachments.office.net/owa/l.gillett1%40lancaster.ac.uk/service.svc/s/GetAttachmentThumbnail?id=AAMkADY0NTVlMTE3LWQ2MmQtNGQ1OC04Y2UyLTA2YmRjZGI3YzdkYQBGAAAAAACaK1rPbJPPT6iGexFVo3ycBwDhBQmAUCIBQI1pt3VSkGtdAAAAAAEMAADhBQmAUCIBQI1pt3VSkGtdAAEF%2FzWtAAABEgAQAEcJrzMAPz1Bvvzn5CKlgKk%3D&thumbnailType=2&token=eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsImtpZCI6IjczRkI5QkJFRjYzNjc4RDRGN0U4NEI0NDBCQUJCMTJBMzM5RDlGOTgiLCJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJ4NXQiOiJjX3VidnZZMmVOVDM2RXRFQzZ1eEtqT2RuNWcifQ..iL2Iz4e3-M9qE8CxfjbJA_zsjBwVZUVUHw5mpUDrq21hU6aRyh5nJz_Ca5q4C9skAJUKjFCY4Vs_jh7itQ0XexGkhJ353pEDBRPZon5ISvsXmMxsT5FJwJHtZezVHfgProPhvmF0C6JsNQ8VJDxTg7cljW_Ah8L97d-erN3SLIg8JPC3KyeBAjvhyU1oWFr3gVvCjJLyPiw9yfgdr8ml7acwkET-a200n-YwJ5z4A-pJKOQq8MVmV3O6JQqWv8eDOHM9PWKZhZA8x_ZW7NVpsCN11vn0VlDxUWDlmSVmuyd_bEesGbi9IJHDsaDszPLMSvGMpwqaU2ZPOrquYW0NrQ&X-OWA-CANARY=BKZH1CeFQEyDiARrulZDO_C6NLdWxNsYXX13dS_3YiahLvGmMbND2xzN-u226z2p6UmP8B16qpk.&owa=outlook.office365.com&scriptVer=20230922005.16&animation=true)

name: Casual Football
description:
Welcome to Lancaster University Casual Football Society**.**Â We aim to provide Lancaster Uni students with a space to play 11-a-side football matches without any commitment to trials or training. We run multiple football sessions every week. Each session is 1 hour long and broken into threeÂ 20 minute games. Three teams of 11 will take turns playing each other so everyone is guaranteed around 40 minutes of time on the pitch.Â 

[Our Linktree for memberships, social media and more.](http://linktr.ee/lancastercasualfootball)

**Session Times**

We currently run 3Â sessions a week:

Monday 5PM-6PMÂ Astro 1

Thursday 5:30PM-7PMÂ Astro 1

Friday 5PM-6PM Astro 1

**Tickets**

Spaces in our sessions are limited so we require all attendees to purchase tickets regardless of membership status. These tickets will sell out quickly so we advise keeping an eye on our social media channels to avoid dissapointment. Non-members can purchase tickets for Â£3 from the SU website using this link: [https://lancastersu.co.uk/groups/casual-football/events](https://lancastersu.co.uk/groups/casual-football/events "https://lancastersu.co.uk/groups/casual-football/events") Anyone without a ticket will not be able to take part in a session regardless of their membership status.

**Memberships**

We offer termly memberships available from the SU website: [https://lancastersu.co.uk/groups/casual-football/join](https://lancastersu.co.uk/groups/casual-football/join "https://lancastersu.co.uk/groups/casual-football/join") Members will have access to free tickets from the SU website and can attend our socials. As of Term 2Â 23/24 these memberships cost Â£20.

**Social Media**

Links to our Instagram and Facebook account can be found here: [https://linktr.ee/lancastercasualfootball](https://linktr.ee/lancastercasualfootball "https://linktr.ee/lancastercasualfootball").

description:

name: Lancaster University Indian Society
description:
Â  Â Â **Welcome to Lancaster University Indian Society!**Â  Â  Â  Â 

Â ![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/430954/original/e934ea35-0a93-4709-9e3b-06cee475b481.jfif)Hi,

We are the Lancaster University Indian Society. We take pride in being a society inclusive to all, for anyone from any background who wants to appreciate the Indian Culture, learn more about their own roots, or just wants to have a good time and take a break from their studies at our fun-filled events.

Our events include chai and movie nights, bollynights, sporting events, Diwali ball, and South Asian ball plus many many more. Our Diwali Ball also won the Student Union'sÂ 'Event of the Year' Award 2021! We also collaborate with other universities such as Leeds Becket for the Biggest Holi Festival in the UK plus many more so you can make friendships and meet people from different Unis.

We aim to make our society as inclusive as possible to everyone at Lancaster University.![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/510256/original/indian_soc_pics.jpg)

Make sure to come down to our events, and join in our fun events to take a break from Uni work, and meet like-minded people, dress up at our balls, or chill and wind down at our sober events. There's always something for everyone, so keep posted through our socials, and buy our memberships to get discounted tickets to our events, and special discounts from our sponsors!!

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/512891/original/WhatsApp_Image_2023-09-25_at_11.06.42.jpeg)

Our execs are always here to make sure you have a good time at our events,Â help you settle into University life, and meet people who are like-minded as you.Â 

Make sure to look out for us on campus and our events. We are always looking for ways we can help you, so if you have any questions, make sure to approach us with any questions you have.Â 

We are also always looking for ways we can improve Indian society to cater to you.Â

name: Parkour and Tricking
description:
Parkour is a sport involvingÂ running, jumping, climbing and vaulting that aims to get from point A to point B as quickly and efficiently as possible. Tricking is a differentÂ sport which involves performingÂ acrobatic flips and tricks to createÂ a fluid and aesthetic movement. The combination of parkour and tricking gives rise to freedomÂ for movement that isÂ different for everyone; the creativity and possibilities are boundless!Â Parkour and trickingÂ will challenge you both physically and mentally and, with practice, you will become fitter andÂ stronger,Â grow in self confidence and conquer your fears!

Lancaster University Parkour and Tricking Society (LUPATS) is a society that welcomesÂ anyone of any ability. We offerÂ comprehensive training which allows you to start with no experience andÂ provide a safeÂ environment with crash mats and soft blocks allowingÂ members to progress quickly and safely.Â LUPATSÂ promotes a friendly atmosphereÂ where members support each other and happilyÂ provide tips and advice when you are learning new skills. The societyÂ has always thrived as a close community that shares experiences such as our annualÂ Easter trip to a European city that resultÂ in great friendships and lasting memories.

If you're looking for something brand new to try at university that provides variety, fun and challenges then join us today or come see us at Fresher's Fair!

We have:

Indoor sessions in George Fox foyer - Tuesday 6-8pm andÂ Thursday 8-10pm

Outdoor sessions all over the place (varying times and locations)

Check out our youtube channel for a taster of what we get up to:Â https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCl9gLmkY-RxaqT\_uN5t5YWQÂ  or check out our Instagram page @lupatsparkour

name: Postgraduate and Mature Students' Forum
description:
Your PGM LCO is Molly Oâ€™Reilly-Kime, a PhD Computer Science student who enjoys good ale and collecting tattoos. You can contact them via the PGM Forum Instagram or by emailing [su.maturestudentsofficer@lancaster.ac.uk](mailto:su.maturestudentsofficer@lancaster.ac.uk)

**What's On This Term:**

**Tea & Coffee**

Join us for a hot drink and a chat every other Thursday, 6:00-8pm in the Sky Lounge @ Infolab

_On Thursday 8th February and Thursday 21st March, there will be a **pub trip** in place of tea and coffee!_

**Sci Fi/Fantasy Fusion Book Club**

Every other Tuesday (on even numbered weeks) in Grad social hub from 6-8pm. This month we're reading The Hitchiker's Guide to the Galaxy by Douglas Adams! The read will be on February 6th (ie, your deadline to finish the book). You can also join our dedicated [book club WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/KIhvKWLwyPgAyn48xU70KG) group to connect with other book lovers.

**Lunch Club**

The last Wednesday of every month is lunch club, where we head to a cafe or restaurant in town for some good food and good company. Venues will vary, keep an eye on our social media for more info! This term, Lunch Club will be on January 31st, February 29th, and March 27th.

**FAQ**

**I have an idea for a social/club. How do I make it happen?**

Let us know! The best way to do this is to come to one of our events and have a chat with Molly, or you can also shoot a message on Instagram, Facebook, WhatsApp (all listed below), or via email (above)

**How do I get involved?**

Come to the socials! The more the merrier. If you want to be involved in a more official capacity, we are running forum elections during week 8 to elect our brand-new PGM Forum Committee. You will need to submit a manifesto as part of your nomination, so start thinking about what you'd like to run for! More info about elections will be released soon, including which roles will be available.

**Am I a Mature Student?**

Youâ€™re a mature student if youâ€™re an Undergraduate who began your degree after your 21st birthday.

**Am I a Postgrad Student?**

Youâ€™re a postgrad student if you are currently doing any kind of postgraduate degree, such as a Masters or a PhD.

Follow us on [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/groups/lusumsf20.21) (remember to answer the security questions!) and [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lusupgandmaturestudents/), and join the [WhatsApp Group](https://chat.whatsapp.com/DdEeod6fVtq4DLA42XQXYC).

All Links can be found on our [LinkTree](https://linktr.ee/lupostgradandmaturestudents)

name: Sexpression Lancaster
description:
Sexpression Lancaster is a branch of the national charity Sexpression UK,Â a near-peer independent UK charity with the goal of empowering young people to make decisions about relationships and sex. We do this by running informal and comprehensive RSE workshops in local schools, and also byÂ running outreach projects, advocacy campaigns, fundraising events and socials on campus.Â All of our members have the option to becomeÂ volunteers for this not for profit organisationÂ and, after receiving full training and a DBS check, are ready to visit schools and other groups in Lancaster and the surrounding areas to faciliate workshops covering a wide range of topics: from contraception and STIs, to healthy relationships and consent, sexual orientation and gender identity, the influence of pornography... and many more! This aspect of the society is not compulsory, however, and we also welcome members who feel that standing in front of a class isn't for themÂ - there's plenty of other things to get involved with!Â 

We believe that access to useful and inclusive RSE is a right, and are passionate about making this available to young people in our local area. We are looking to recruit members who are also passionate about this issue, to join our team of volunteers and to help us to deliver as many workshops as possible - and to spread the word about Sexpression and all things sexual health - over the coming year! Our members will also have the opportunity to be involved in our socials, on-campus campaigns andÂ fundraising events, as well as national sex education conferences.

For more information about Sexpression Lancaster and how to get involved, don't hesitate to get in touch in the following ways:

*   Email: lancaster@sexpression.org.uk
*   Instagram:Â @lancastersexpression
*   Twitter:Â @SexpressionLanc

We look forward to hearing from you soon! :)

name: Gaming and Esports Society
description:
**Welcome toÂ the Gaming & Esports society!**

We host a wide variety of events, going from Socials, to Tournaments and then our LAN Parties! Here is our selection:

*   **Out-Of-Bounds**: Weekly in Bowland Seminar Rooms, Tuesday from 7PMÂ - Casual community games, quizzes and hanging outÂ (No drinking needed!). We post our game for the big screen on our discord at the start of every week! If you have a game you'd like to play you are more than welcome to come and join!Â 
*   **Smash Weeklies:**Â Held across Campus, come along and take part in our friendly tournaments regardless of your skill level or experience.
*   **Termly Mario Kart Tournament:**Â Every term we set up a Mario Kart tournament for you to come and compete in! Play in randomly chosen courses on Mario Kart 8 Deluxe on theÂ big screen.Â Win trophies, prizes and much more
*   **LAN**: We run at least 2 LANs per term, where we all come together with our kit in Bowland North Seminar Rooms, and spend the weekend gaming, taking part in tournaments, holding our General Meetings, and a bunch of other dynamic activities we will have planned.
*   **Bailrigg Smash Tournament**: This termly tournament brings together people from around the world to take part in a range of Smash games, with money and medals up for grabs for the best in each series.
*   **Roses**: Our annual tournament against the University of York goes back many decades, but eSports is one of the latest additions, and we look for the best players in the whole University to represent us and bring us victory in League of Legends, VALORANT, DoTA2, CS:GO, Overwatch, Rocket League and Smash Ultimate.
*   **NUEL**: Our Society teams also take part in the NUEL Tournaments, which are termly, and take place between any and all of the Universities in the UK, our R6 Siege team have come first place this year!
*   **NSE**:Â  As anÂ official body for university esports they're a critical part of the university social experience for future generations and endeavour to create a world where players that engage with university esports become more confident and successful as a result through their partnership with British Universities & Colleges Sport (BUCS). We are proud to say that our Rocket League team won this year and our R6 Siege team came 2nd!

The best way to keep in contact with us is our discord, which you can join at [discord.gg/luges](http://discord.gg/luges), and we also have [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/OfficialLUGES/),Â [Twitter](https://twitter.com/OfficialLUGES), [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/OfficialLUGES/),Â and our own [Website](https://lancaster.ac.uk/luges).

You can also follow us on [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/officialLUGES)!

**We look forward to meeting you!**

name: Debating
description:
The Lancaster Debating Union (LDU) is a welcoming society debating topics ranging from politics to pop-culture. We mostly practice and compete with British Parliamentary style debating, and offer our members the chance to compete in national and international debating competitions (both online and in-person) and teach in local schools.

EveryÂ Wednesday afternoon, we hostÂ training sessions for our members to help improve their argument building and public speaking skills. We also host termly public debates, normally on campus,Â in which LDU members can practice their public speaking. Lastly, we run biweekly socials, including both alcoholic and non-alcoholic socials.

As well as being very enjoyable, competitive debating helps to give you the critical thinking and communication skills necessary for a successful future professional career. All students are welcome!

**Lancaster University Equestrian Club**
========================================

#### **If you are looking to experienceÂ the** joys o**f equestrian sport, events, and socials -Â theÂ Equestrian Club is the one for you!** Â 

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/469745/original/DA6B4953-57F1-4774-B644-CFFA37A1D9E0.jpeg)

The minimum requirement for you to join us as a riding member is that you can walk, trot and canter.

To become a social member no prior knowledge of horse riding is needed! Just come along to our Wednesday night socials, film nights, and excursions - Badminton Horse Trials is a firm favourite.

We offer three membership types: Team, Lessons and Social.Â Each membership types haveÂ different benefitsÂ that are suited to your needs and will inspire you to reach your individual equine goals.Â Whether you want to be prepared for competitions or reconnect with your long-lost riding skills, we have a place for you.  
Â 

**Team:**Â Training is on a Wednesday afternoon at Bigland Hall Equine. We currently have threeÂ teams of varying levels, who compete against other universities throughout the year.Â Team Trials are held in week 1 of term; after successful trials, membership is an annual payment of Â£50 in addition to the weekly cost of training sessions.Â 

**Lessons:**Â Members ride on a Wednesday afternoon at Larkrigg Riding Centre,Â located in Cumbria.Â Membership is Â£40 annually plus the individual cost of each lesson you attend.

**Social:**Â This is a perfect option forÂ those who want to get to know more about horses without the commitment of riding. We hold weekly socials on a Wednesday night, plus lots of fun extras.Â We can't wait to get back to all our in person events.Â Membership is only Â£10 for the year!

If you have any queries, please message us on ourÂ **[Facebook page](https://www.facebook.com/LUEquestrianclub/)**Â or **[email](mailto:equestrian.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk)**Â our execs. Also don't forget to check out ourÂ **[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lu_equestrianclub/)**Â page to keep up to date with the club!

**Until then, we can't wait to see you!**

name: Lancaster University Conservative Society
description:
**LANCASTER UNIVERSITY CONSERVATIVE SOCIETY**

**[www.lanunicons.co.uk](http://lanunicons.co.uk)**

**2022-23Â Membership Fee:** Â£5.00Â 

**About us**

Lancaster University Conservative Society, more commonly known as â€˜LUCSâ€™, is the most active student political society on the Lancaster campus. Our mission is to promote the values and policies of the Conservative and Unionist Party at Lancaster University. LUCS equally serves as a forum for discussion and debate, as well as a social scene for like-minded students.Â 

Our society activities can be divided into three categories: debate, activism, and socials:Â 

![May be an image of 11 people and people standing](https://scontent-lhr8-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.30808-6/244757056_10159274351173476_6439254931678430552_n.jpg?_nc_cat=110&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=e3f864&_nc_ohc=AQwl2m5uX-IAX99-5Gz&_nc_ht=scontent-lhr8-1.xx&oh=00_AT_omP1erxrRCxQRZTZXNfL0Qfefd2YULDekdfCCVwTTrQ&oe=6340C7E1)

**Debate**

Every week we host a wide range of exciting and intellectually stimulating debates on a vast array of political issues, both old and new. LUCS takes pride in our broad-church nature, welcoming students of all views from across the political spectrum. We encourage all our members to express their views, giving everyone the chance to articulate their thoughts and ask pertinent questions.â€‹ Our meetings take place every **Wednesday during term time at 6PM in Elizabeth Livingston Lecture Theatre**.

LUCS also seeks to provide wide-ranging opportunities to hear from the leading lights of the political right by welcoming high-profile guest speakers.

Furthermore, we collaborate with other student political societies to organise regular â€˜Question Timeâ€™ events where we can truly engage in the battle of ideas against the other parties.

**Activism**

LUCS is also a campaigning organisation, and we actively encourage our members to get involved in grassroots activism. We are proud of the values of the Conservative Party, and proud of putting them into practice. We work hard to get Conservative candidates elected by supporting election campaigns across Lancashire and the wider North West England region. In recent years, LUCS has supported Conservative candidates in City Council, County Council, and General Elections.

For those who have never campaigned before, LUCS organises campaigning and canvassing training, and boasts several experienced campaigners amongst our ranks to help you out on the doorstep.

Moreover, our members have regularly stood in local elections across the country. At the 2022Â LocalÂ elections, many LUCS members were Conservative Party candidates in wards across the country. Lancaster University falls within its own ward in Lancaster City Council â€“ University and Scotforth Rural â€“ thus it is usually our members who rise to the challenge of contesting this seat.

LUCS also endeavours to connect our members with fellow conservatives across the UK. We arrange trips to Conservative Party events such as the Conservative Party Conference and the Conservative Party Spring Forum, giving our members the very best networking opportunities.

Frequent media opportunities are presented to LUCS members from media outlets from a university to national level, giving them a platform to discuss their views.

Not all our activism is political. LUCS is also committed to supporting charitable causes, at both a local and national level. We organise an annual collection for the Royal British Legionâ€™s Poppy Appeal and support a range of local charities in their community endeavours.

**Socials**

As well as being a political society, LUCS is also an active social scene, with socials every week organised by our Social Secretary! Our socials are incredibly diverse, so thereâ€™s something for everyone.

Some of our social events have included:

*   Lancaster and Fleetwood Constituency Association Patronsâ€™ DinnerÂ 
    
*   Brexit social
    
*   Christmas meal
    
*   Cards night
    
*   Pub quizzes
    
*   Karaoke (â€˜Tory-okeâ€™!)
    
*   Film club
    
*   Cross-party football cup
    
*   Bar sports evening
    

Whatâ€™s more, after all of our weekly meetings LUCS heads for a pint at County Bar (RIP Grad Bar). Most weeks, this usually leads to a night out at the Sugarhouse too!

**Join us**

LUCS membership, priced at Â£5 per academic year, gives you exclusive access to:

*   All LUCS events - weekly meetings, socials, campaigning days, and anything else we organise.
    
*   Our social media package - weekly email updates, the LUCS Facebook group and group chat, the LUCS memes page.
    
*   Full society voting rights, including the right to stand for the Executive Committee.
    

If you're interested in joining LUCS or supporting our work, please click the orange '**JOIN THIS GROUP**' button at the top of the page and request to join our Society!

**Contact**

**Visit our website: [www.lanunicons.co.uk](http://lanunicons.co.uk)**

**Weekly meetings**

*   _When?_ 6PM, every Wednesday during term time
    
*   _Where?_Â Elizabeth Livingston Lecture Theatre, Bowland North
    

**You can contact LUCS via e-mail or any ofÂ  our social media accounts:â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹**

*   E-Mail: lucspublicity@gmail.com
    
*   Facebook: www.facebook.com/LanUniCons
    
*   Twitter: www.twitter.com/LanUniCons
    
*   Instagram: www.instagram.com/LanUniCons
    

**Alternatively, you can write to us:**

Lancaster University Conservative Society

Lancaster University Students' Union, Bowland Main

Lancaster University

Lancashire

LA1 4YT

**Executive Committee**

*   Chairman - Daniel Kirk
    
*   Vice Chairman - Harvey Hayes
    
*   General Secretary - Odhran Shelton
    
*   Treasurer - Ivan Taran
    
*   Social Secretary - Tom Berridge
    
*   Media and Publicity Secretary - Owen Limerick

name: Enactus Lancaster
description:
**Here at Enactus LancasterÂ we believe that the power of business can solve the world's toughest social and environmental problems.**Â 

We are a community of students, academics, and business leaders committed to usingÂ entrepreneurial action to transform lives and shape a better, more sustainable world.

We live by the philosophy of "feed a man a fish and he will eat for a day, teach him how to fish and heÂ will eat for a lifetime"Â and implement it throughout our social enterprises.Â   
  
Enactus Lancaster will be running 7Â projects this year:Â **Areospark, Refillar, PurifiQ, Girls Get Diagnosed,**Â **Silver Years, Cherry,**Â and **HOPE.**

*   **Areospark:** An international project aimingÂ to developÂ wind-turbineÂ schematicsÂ tailoredÂ to varying resource availability. Â In PartnershipÂ with Lancaster University Ghana and Akoma Hearts of Ghana.
*   **Refillar:** The aimÂ is to improve the food waste issues in Lancaster by selling cheap food boxes and also giving free foodboxes to tackle food poverty.
*   **Purifiq**: A project which has created a brand new innovative product-Â "Toothpop". Â ItÂ is encased in a seaweed membrane and whenÂ in the mouth andÂ inÂ contact with water, itÂ transforms into a toothpaste!Â 
*   **Girls Get Diagnosed:** A local project foccused on the development ofÂ an online forum to improve the diagnosis of autism among girls who are four times less likely to be diagnosed.
*   **Silver Years:**Â A local project aimed towards educating the elderly in the ways of how technology can enrich thier lives, bridging the intergenerational technology gap.
*   **Cherry:**Â A local project seeking to create an online charity shop. Â The project aspires to create an e-commerce website where participants can raise money for charity by selling their clothes via the Cherry website.
*   **HOPE:**Â A project aiming to capitalise on the current NFT trend by selling Influencer inspired NFT creations, designed by local artists.

#### Among our sponsors are: **Unilever, KPMG, Amazon,Â Barclays, SAP, EY, Visa, Ford and MANY MORE...**

We haveÂ **exciting** opportunities for you to develop your leadership and potentially create your own project. Contact us for more details!

By joining you will:

**\- Impact the lives of people in your local community**

**\- Work on an international social enterprise**

**\- Gain invaulabeÂ real-life business experience**

**\- Focus on your own personal growth**

**\- Meet like-mindedÂ people**

To see our social media accounts and our application form, follow this link: Â **https://linktr.ee/enactuslancaster**

name: Cycling
description:
**Welcome to Lancaster University Cycling Club!**

Don't have your own bike? We've got aÂ range of club bikes available to borrow. Want to try mountain biking? We run termly hire bike trips to local trails so you can give it a go. Do you already compete in cycle races? We have our own series of races and multiple members already competing at a national level.

At Lancaster University Cycling Club, we aim to provide an inclusive experience for all riders. No matter your fitness, cycling is a brilliant way to explore the beautiful Lancashire countryside and make new friends at the same time.Â We run trips throughout the year such as theÂ annual mountain bike tripÂ to Innerleithen, weekend road trips to Wales, and visits to the National Cycling Centre in Manchester.Â 

We encourage you to race and push yourself, but there is also a large social side to the club with drinking and sober socials. We run women's specific events and rides at multiple paces to match your ability.

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/513159/original/road_image.jpeg)![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/513158/original/mtb_image.jpeg)

**Weekly Schedule**

*   **Wednesday (2 PMÂ @ Slaidburn HouseÂ on Campus):** Social, medium & fast road rides
*   **Wednesday (Afternoon):**Â MTB rides at local trails such as Chapel house andÂ GisburnÂ 
*   **Friday (Evenings, Weekly):** Socials follow a different theme each week, with a balance between drinking and sober activities such as bouldering or a games night.Â 

**Event Schedule**

*   **MTB Hire trip (Termly):** We head off to local trails such as Whinlatter and offer the option to bring your bike or hire one.
*   **MTB Trip (Termly):**Â MTB trips with no hire bikes. One day trip and one weekend trip per term.
*   **BMX trip (Term 1):**Â A trip to Manchester BMX track where you can give BMXingÂ a go, with a fully coached session. All kit and bikes provided. No prior experience is needed.Â 
*   **Velodrome trip (Term 2):** A trip to the velodrome where you can give track cycling a go. Bikes & shoes are hired at the track.
*   **RoadÂ Weekend TripÂ (Term 2):**Â A weekend away for the roadies. Back-to-back days of flowing routes and admirable views.Â 
*   **24 Hour Turbo (Term 2):**Â A charity event. Run in the centre of Alex square.
*   **BUCS (Easter break):**Â A series of inter-uni MTB and road competitions. Entry and travel are subsidised by the club and the students union.
*   **Roses (Term 3):**Â The varsity held between York and Lancaster University. The main sporting event in the calendar. There are MTB and road events on offer.Â 

Road membership costs Â£20 with Â£15 early-bird price during freshers week and the first two weeks of term.

MTB membership costs Â£25Â with Â£20Â early-bird price during freshers week and the first two weeks of term.

Â For this cost you get:

*   Access to road/MTB rides along with bike hire
*   Discounts at Aquila Pizzeria and Leisure Lakes Bikes
*   Access to tripsÂ and training sessions
*   Socials
*   Discounted race entry

\*MTB members only

Visit our FacebookÂ [group](https://www.facebook.com/groups/210017249601641/) &Â [page](https://www.facebook.com/LancasterUniCC/), as well as the [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lancasteruniversitycycling/)Â to see whatÂ happened in the past year, and to keep up with current information.

We hope to see you soon!

name: Motorsport Society
description:
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Â  Â  Â ![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/463976/original/LogoMain.jpg)

**The fastest society on campus...**

Welcome all racingÂ fans! Whether a casual observer or a regular racer, the society is open to everyone!

Lancaster Motorsport is the society for all things fast. Whether it's watching Formula 1 races, karting or generally meeting others with an interest for all things motorsport-relatedÂ we are the society for you!

  
What we do:  
Â 

*   Formula 1 viewings
*   Weekly socials
*   Regular karting events
*   Women in Motorsport
*   Compete in the British University Karting Championship
*   Visit car meets andÂ society trips

  
Winners of 'Leaps and Bounds' society award 2023,Â the new exec looks to further advance and develop the society in the upcoming year!

Dont miss out, there is alot to come!

Find out about ourÂ events this year on our website:Â [Upcoming Events](https://www.lancastermotorsport.co.uk/upcomingevents)

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/502066/original/DSCF7268.JPG)**Joining Lancaster this year?**Â 

The Motorsport Society stands as one of the biggest societies at Lancaster University and is a great place to meet others attending university. We're a vibrant community where you can connect with fellow students.

If you're a passionate Formula 1 fan, this is the perfect society for you.

Whether you love racing, cars, or Top Gear, we've got you covered.

Even if you've never raced in karts or have limited knowledge about motorsports, joining us is still worthwhile.Â We pride ourselves on being a friendly and inclusive community, ready to help newcomers dive into the world of motorsports and try something new.

If you have any questions about the university or our society, don't hesitate to reach out to any of our exec members or our fresher representative, Tom Haywood-Stott (tomhaywoodstott on Snapchat). Additionally, if you're eager to connect with other Formula 1 and motorsports enthusiasts before arriving at university, be sure to join our Freshers group:Â [https://t.snapchat.com/QkT9tD9t](https://t.snapchat.com/QkT9tD9t)

**Race Viewings**

**![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/502545/original/IMG_8628.JPG)**The society streams all Formula 1 qualifiers and races during term time! Qualifying is typically watched on campusÂ whileÂ races are streamed atÂ bars in the city centre.

Race viewings provided the opportunity to meet other fans, socialise and watch the races in a hyped but friendly atmosphere! Regardless of your team or level of knowledge, all members are welcome to come and watchalong!

Typically Formula 1 race viewings are themed, whether it's an All American-themed US Grand Prix or BBQ-themed AustralianÂ Grand Prix.

We also watch series other than Formula 1 however, throughout the year also watching Formula E, Indycar, MotoGP and more during the off-season! Such viewings provide opportunities to find out and learn about other racing series!

**Casual Karting**

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/502644/original/334510170_877791909979509_2072518343768681083_n.jpg)The society however does more than sit around and watch races, holding regular karting socials to local circuits. These includeÂ to indoor circuits such as Teamsport Warrington, Preston and Manchester alongside visits to outdoor circuits such as Three Sisters and Rowrah.

These events are open to all members, regardless of skill level and are good opportunity to learn the ropes of karting with friends.

As a part of karting we hold an internal karting championship throughout the year! Drivers will be allocated points depending on their fastest lap times from socials, with their best results from 4 events determining their score at the end!Â 

**Society socials**

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/502638/original/DJI_20230125_211245_916.jpg)As a society weÂ also hold regular socials for members to interact and go out. These range from themed socials such as 'Red Carpet' and 'Anything but a hat' to more chill socials such as Quiz Nights,Â esports socials and more!

Such socials occur every Wednesday and will be announced in advance on our socials.Â 

We also host bigger social events such the annual Christmas Dinner and end-of-year BBQ.

We are also looking to collab with more societies this year with plans in the works for socials with Take2Cinema and LUGES.Â  Any other societies that are interested in collabrating with us should feel free to get in contact on our Instagram!

Any questions about our socials or events this year feel free to get in contact with ourÂ Social SecsÂ [@samuel vodden](https://www.instagram.com/samuelvodden/)Â andÂ [@molly woodmass](https://www.instagram.com/molly.gxorgia/)

**British University Karting Championship![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/502554/original/IMG_5503.JPG)**

Similar to BUCS for other sports teams, the â€˜BUKCâ€™ is the highest level of competitive racing for UK universities.Â Ran on powerful Club100 karts around various premier outdoor tracks across the country, the championship allows for some exciting racing.Â 

Last year, Lancaster Motorsport managed to successfully qualify two teams into the championship. It was an impressive feat for our teams, and we are proud to have achieved a remarkable 30th place finish in the mains BUKC championship.

Similarly, our B-team secured an impressive 20th place finish in their respective championship, with numerous top 10 results to their credit. Next year we are hoping to double the number of teams with trials open in early October!

We also compete in the BUKC 24hrs, an endurance karting event hosted at the end of the academic year up at Teesside International Circuit. Last year we submitted 3 teams for a total of 24 drivers!

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/502555/original/P6160096.JPG)During the early phases of the race A-team gained 12Â places out of qualifying to enter second place challenging for first before technical mishaps unfortunately brought an end to podium contention.

If you are interested in racing for Lancaster in the BUKC there will be trials for both the Premier and Intermediate teams early in first term.Â Make sure to join our social channels and keep an eye out for announcements!

Watch how ourÂ 2023Â BUKC 24hrs unfolded:Â [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINt\_qJf2To&t](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINt_qJf2To&t)

For more information on the BUKC, have a look at their website: [https://www.bukc.co.uk/](https://www.bukc.co.uk/)

Any questions about BUKC or trials feel free to contact our Karting CaptainsÂ [@ash kandola](https://www.instagram.com/ash_kandola/)Â and [@matthew roberts](https://www.instagram.com/mattyroberts04/)

**Other competitive karting**![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/502070/original/IMG_0504.JPG)

Our teams however do not solely compete in the BUKC, also racing in the Northern Rental Karting League (NRKL) with takes place at a range of circuits across the North of England and is a useful step for drivers to practice for BUKC.

2023 marked the first time Lancaster Motorsport competed in Roses - the biggest inter-university varsity in Europe!

Racing at York's home circuit our team was able to gain places after qualifying to a surprisingly narrow points gap. This year we are looking forward to hosting York at home!

**Women in Motorsport**Â 

**![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/502612/original/CE2F3759-0FA7-401A-B390-3F9A3A54F87C.jpeg)**For the first time in the society's history Women in Motorsport at Lancaster University is here! WiM allows those interested to joinÂ in exclusive women-only karting trips (regardless of previous experience), various socials throughout the year and find others like themselves who enjoy motorsport as a whole.

Not separate from Lancaster University Motorsport Society, rather a way to get more women involved in motorsport to enjoy as a community!

As a society, we understand the importance of acknowledging the lack of female representation within motorsport and we feel it is only right for us to encourage more girls to join our society and find a community where they can freely enjoy motorsport alongside like-minded people.

Any questions or you are interested in being added to the WiM chat message the Diversity Officer [@arya bhandari](https://www.instagram.com/arya.bhandari/)Â on Instagram

**The University Stig![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/502619/original/Stig.JPG)**

  
Some say that he only eats Greggs...  
Â 

...and that he's scared of the campus ducks...  
Â 

...all we know is he's not the Stig...  
Â 

... he's the Stig's University Cousin!

Keep an eye out for [Lancaster Stig](https://www.instagram.com/lancasterstig/)Â out in the wild around campus and our Race to the Stig event in Welcome Week!

**Society trips and car meets![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/502616/original/IMG_1344.JPG)**

This year we are looking into hosting more society trips and attend more car meets!

After the success of the Festa Italia car meet we are hoping to attend more car meets in the North West.

For those with interests in car photography this provides the chance to get up and close for some high quality photos!

New to this year we are introducing society (road) trips! These will vary in length and distance but will only be open to members to attend.Â 

\- Trip to Windermere - during welcome week we will be heading to Windermere on the train as a chance for those recently joining Lancaster to visit the Lake District

name: Lancaster SSAGO (Student Scouts And Guides)
description:
**Lancaster SSAGO** is a medium-sized and very friendly club which is open to any students from Lancaster University and the University of Cumbria. We do something fun every Tuesday night like film and pizza nights, scavenger hunts around campus, bowling and board games - and after the exciting bits we usually go and have a quiet drink in a college bar. During Term time you can generally find us in Welcome Centre Lecture Theatre 1 on Tuesdays 7:30 - 9:30.

Weâ€™re part of a national network ([SSAGO, the Student Sc](https://www.ssago.org/clubs/view/lancaster)[out And Guide Organisation](https://www.ssago.org/clubs/view/lancaster)) of over 40 universities which means we can offer the unique opportunity to travel around and meet with students with similar interests from across the UK at [rallies](https://www.ssago.org/events) (big national camps) held every term and our annual ball, where a range of activities are on offer - including hiking, trampolining, climbing, kayaking, bar crawls, and, of course, a campfire!

We organise two of our own camps every year too; a weekend Freshers' Camp in November and a whole week Summer Camp in the penultimate week of the year. We also hold an alumni sleepover in a scout hut in Lancaster in Lent term where we meet up with our graduate friends!

For those who wish to volunteer, we work closely with both Scouting and Guiding in Lancaster so there are numerous opportunities to get involved with local Groups and Units, whether this is on a weekly basis or just for one off events!

Membership currentlyÂ only costs Â£6Â per term!

Weâ€™re open to everyone, including those whoâ€™ve never been involved with Scouts or Guides before, so do come along - weâ€™d love to meet you, and our socials are an excellent way of making new friends and trying out things you wouldn't usually do! And we're all lovely, so if you have any questions at all then just email us (lancasterssago@gmail.com) or find us on [facebook](https://www.facebook.com/groups/LancasterSSAGO/)Â ![smile](https://html-online.com/editor/tinymce4_6_5/plugins/emoticons/img/smiley-smile.gif)Â 

![Image result for facebook logo](https://image.freepik.com/free-icon/facebook-logo_318-49940.jpg)Â  Â facebook.com/groups/LancasterSSAGOÂ  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â ![Image result for email black and white](https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRVdsNXOfHQflfe2ru-KDnZ9hV2fF7_s9veRVUzH0vvVNTyJN_t)Â  Â  lancasterssago@gmail.com

name: Lancaster University Investment and Finance Society
description:
**Discover Lancaster University's only investment society, bringing consulting, accounting, business and investing into one place.**

We aim to increase members financial knowledge and awareness of the varying opportunities available in the sector- encouraging our members to build their professional network every step of the way.Â  We are proud organisers of a variety of exceptional events, such as our flagship **â€˜Lancaster Forumâ€™** event, giving our members the perfect opportunity to network with industry professionals and gain an insight into life at **Jefferies, Deutsche Bank, Bank of America, Marsh McLennan, EY Parthenon**, and the list goes on!

There is also an opportunity to join our very own **Ghosal Investment Fund**Â which aims to develop a deep understanding of financial markets, experience equity investment on a first-hand basis and gain exposure to real-life situations related to asset management**.**Â Everyone from first-years to PhD students is welcome to apply for a position!

We are committed to professional development, organising a variety of workshops to develop the skills needed in the sector.

**Our successful initiatives include:**

*   Access - Our initiative designed to bring together diversity and inclusion events into one space. Making it easier for those underrepresented in High Finance to find opportunities available for them and network with established professionals.
*   McCormick Consulting - A global consulting initiative that gives students the opportunity to work on real-life consulting deals for clients.
*   Ghosal Academy - Teaching students the necessary fundamental and technical skills needed to succeed in Investment Banking

Previous LUIFS members have said time and time again that getting involved in the society provided them with the transferable skills and industry contacts necessary to give them an edge to succeed in job applications.

We also run a series of social events for members where they can meet others interested in finance and engage in the subject without being solely focused on careers!

**So what are you waiting for?Â  No matter your degree discipline, if you have a passion for the industry or want to find out more about the financial sector, this is the society for you!**

To keep up with our activities;

**Instagram**:Â [https://www.instagram.com/luifsoc/](https://www.instagram.com/luifsoc/)Â 

Website:Â [https://www.luifs.com/](http://www.luifs.com)

To keep up with our achievements:

name: Lancaster University First Aid Society
description:
We are a society that offers the opportunity to learn invaluable first aid skillsÂ as well as make great friends and volunteer your time to help others!

We meet on a Monday evening on campus where we learn valuable first aid skills such as CPR, head injuries, bleeding, triaging and so much more. On a Wednesday we cover first aid for the university's BUCS matches, usually rugby and football. This allows us to gain valuable experience and all members are welcome, no matter their skills.

Being a part of the first aid society is a great stepping stone into volunteering with St John Ambulance (SJA), England's leading first aid charity. We welcome existing members, and are happy to help anyone interested in becoming an SJA volunteer.

We welcome members at any timeÂ of the year!

We meet every Monday at 8pm in Welcome Centre LT2 A23.

Contact us to find out more!

firstaid.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk

President - Louise Jones - l.h.jones@lancaster.ac.uk

Follow our Facebook! @LancasterFirstAidSocietyÂ 

Follow our Instagram! @lancasterfirstaid

name: Engineers Without Borders
description:
Engineers Without Borders - LancasterÂ (EWB-Lancaster) is a society that is affiliated with [EWB-UK](https://www.ewb-uk.org). We aim to drive a movement that inspires, enables and influences global responsibility through engineering. We welcome everyone who has a passion for making a difference!Â 

Our society is split into three main areas:

*   PROJECTS - We work on projects that focusÂ on creating positive change, both within the University and the wider community. These not only make a difference, but look great on your CV, and will help you to stand out when applying for placements and graduate jobs.

*   EVENTS - We holdÂ workshops, spotlight talks,Â networking events, and of course socials! Not only will you meet other people who care about using their skills to make a difference, but you'll also learn from industry leaders implementing positive change today.

*   OUTREACH - By visiting local schools, we focus on inspiring the younger generation to help the planet. We also put on workshops to help you develop skills that will allow you to think about how you impact the planet. You can pass on your skills, learn from other students, and promote globally responsible engineering.

There is no Planet B, so we need to work to save ours.Â Join us for just **Â£5 a year!**

Check out our [Linktree](https://linktr.ee/ewblancaster) for more information about the society and all our contact details.

name: Volleyball Club
description:
**Lancaster University Volleyball Club**

  
We are theÂ only volleyball club at the University!Â We're a really inclusive club, and we have two highly competitive teams.Â Both our men's and women's teams aim to perform to theÂ highest level, and train hardÂ to achieve great results. Both of our teams are in Division 1 BUCS League which is an achievement we are very proud of.Â We trainÂ twice perÂ week, alongsideÂ additional gym sessions, so you'll get loadsÂ of opportunitiesÂ to bond with the other players, and develop some great friendships.

We're two teams, but we're ONE club, and we interact as such; we think it's hugely important to develop our team chemistry as much as we develop our technical skills. To do this, we host lots of creative socials, that are fun for everyone to get involved with - ensuring we have a greatÂ time on, and off, the volleyball court!

We also look to spread the volleyball spirit all across campus and we invite everybody to try our beloved sport out! Our recreational sessions are widely popular and we invite you to join us for some casual games if you have never played before or if you would like to get involved and learn more about the sport. You would have the opportunity to play in a team and learn new skills as well as play some light-hearted games. We are looking forward to welcoming you all!

name: Lancaster Snow
description:
**LANCASTER SNOW**Â 

**Welcome to Lancaster Universityâ€™s Snowsports club.**Â 

We are a friendly, lively and inclusive sports club that take part and compete in different Snowsports activities. Lancaster Snow is a great club to join if you enjoy skiing or snowboarding, want to try something new or just want to make friends.Â We offer two types of membership, full membership or social membership, which can be bought all year round.

BeginnersÂ 

Skiing and snowboarding areÂ fun sports that anyone can try. We will be running beginner lessons at Rossendale ski slope where the price of lessons will be dependent on the number of people who sign up so get as many people involved and try a new sport!Â 

TrainingÂ Â 

If you can ski/snowboard, we encourage you to try our race training sessions, no previous race experience is needed. Our training sessions take place at Rossendale ski slope where a slalom course will be set up and you will learn how to raceÂ through the gates at speed.Â 

RacesÂ 

Our race teams competeÂ in many dry slope races throughout the year including Kings, BUDS and Roses. Our ski team finished 3rdÂ in the Kings league 21/22 season and followed it up with another top 10 result last year. Anyone can get involved in dry slope races, we encourage spectators, and it is and enjoyable day for everyone who comes along.Â 

TripsÂ 

Each year we organise a ski trip to the Alps with the help of a reputable tour operator. Our trip committee works closely with the company to create an unmissable trip at the best value. Trips are a great way to meet new people and make unforgettable memories in the mountains. The club also organises a trip to Chill Factore once a term. Chill Factore is an indoor ski slope with real snow located in Manchester.Â Â 

SocialsÂ 

Lancaster Snow runs a variety of 'snocials' throughout the year, lots of these you will not want to miss! We encourage all our members to come to our socials and get involved. We also organise annual events including a Winter Ball and a Summer BBQ.Â Â 

Any questions just get in touch:Â 

Facebook â€“ Lancaster SnowÂ 

Instagram â€“ lancaster\_snow\_clubÂ 

E-mail â€“Â [lancaster.snow.club@gmail.com](mailto:lancaster.snow.club@gmail.com)Â 

We hope you join us on the slopes this year!

name: Lancaster University Pro Wrestling Society
description:
LUPW is Lancaster University's Pro Wrestling fan society. We welcome all fans of any kind of wrestling,Â be it WWE, AEW, Impact, ROH, NJPW or any of the hundreds of indie companies around the world. As a society, we host weekly meetings on Wednesday evenings where we do various activities such as quizzes, gaming, themed watch parties, movie nights, and more. Outside of our meetings we also run various socials, such asÂ PPV screenings, nights out, predictions contests, discussions on weekly events,Â  and, of course, trips to wrestling shows. For LUPW members only there is an exclusive discount on tickets for local wrestling company, Odyssey Pro Wrestling.Â 

And the best part is... membership is completely FREE!Â 

Whether you're a diehard enthusiastÂ or simply a casual fan, a fresher or a PhD student, all are welcome!

LUPW is a small, friendly, inclusive society where you can make friends and share your love of the sport.Â But don't just take our word for it, here are some quotes from previous members:

"Out of curiosity I attended the first ever meeting of the LUPW society and would have never expected to have as much fun or meet such awesome people."

"Since joining LUPW I have laughed in times when I really needed to laugh. Itâ€™s not a huge society but thatâ€™s its charm, itâ€™s like meeting a group of friends every week and having a blast."

"The most fun Iâ€™ve had at uni has been with LUPW. Thereâ€™s something about being a wrestling fan and meeting other wrestling fans that is simply incredible."

"LUPW has been key to making my university experience what it is and I have met some lifelong friends here."

name: Ultimate Frisbee
description:
**Lancaster University Ultimate Frisbee Club**

Lancaster Ultimate, also known as 'The Fish,'Â is a clubÂ providing a great way to get involved in a growing, mixed-gender, fast-paced and fun sport. There are both indoor and outdoor variations of Ultimate Frisbee, each requiring different tactics and skill sets, joining the Fish will give you the opportunity to play in both.Â On top of several Mixed tournaments throughout the year, we compete annually in Menâ€™s and Womenâ€™s BUCS leagues and tournaments. More information about the sport and its rules can be found on our socials and on the UK Ultimate website: [https://www.ukultimate.com](https://www.ukultimate.com)

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/215585/original/fish_fish.jpg)

**Training Times Term 2Â 23/24:**

**Tuesday â€“ 7:30am-9am - 3G Pitch â€“ Open to everyone**

**Friday â€“ 6-7:30pm - Sports Hall 2 â€“ Open to everyone**

**Friday â€“ 7:30pm-9pm â€“ Sports Hall 2 â€“ Experienced only**

**Sunday â€“ 2pm-4pm â€“ Football Pitch 1Â â€“ Open to everyone**

The majority of students joining the club have no previous playing experience within the sport but will see a rapid growth in skill level and game confidence thanks to coaching from GB level players, our amazing coach Max, as well as our 3 weekly training sessions.Â The Fish regularly field multiple teams at weekend tournaments around the country, allowing new members plenty of game time andÂ the chance to develop their game and socialise with players from other clubs, universities and regions.

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/431282/original/3.PNG)

If playing in fun and competitive tournaments up and down the country wasnâ€™t enough, we also participate in the biggest inter-university sports tournament in Europe, Roses! Ultimate takes a big role within Roses having 6 matches across the weekend and there is the chance for all players to represent Lancaster. This weekend is one of fierce rivalry and certainly not one to be missed.Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â 

Each year in the final weeks of term three we host our own tournament, â€˜Fishbowlâ€™, which offers our alumni a chance to return and draws some of the best teams in fromÂ across the UK. Being a part of The Fish doesnâ€™t stop when you graduate.

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/431281/original/2.PNG)

**Socials**

Outside of training sessions and games, the club has a strong social sceneÂ organising weekly socials. Whether youâ€™ll be embarking on the classic zip-tied bar crawl, teaming

up for the famous Scavenger Hunt, getting competitive at games night, or joining us for a bit of karaoke at Crafty, or; there is something for everyone.Â 

For more information on how to get involved follow our social media:

Instagram: [https://www.instagram.com/lancasterfish](https://www.instagram.com/lancasterfish)

Facebook:Â [www.facebook.com/groups/lancasterfrisbee](https://www.facebook.com/groups/lancasterfrisbee)

name: Labour Club
description:
Welcome!
--------

Lancaster University Labour Club is the largest political society on campus, guided by underlying principles of equality, collectivism, social justice, unity, and tolerance, and we seek to provide a welcoming space for all. We host weekly meetings to discuss and debate various exciting topics, along with regular socials and events including our very popular presentation evenings. Together we have won many elections including a council by-election in the university ward in November 2021, and gettingÂ a councellor elected in the recent city council elections.Â We have close ties withÂ the local Labour Party, the UCU, and other groups across Lancaster.Â 

If you are interested inÂ meeting your MP, learning more about the Labour Party, or just having lively political debates, come along to one of our weekly meetings. We usually focus on current affairs, and throughout the year, we have some excellent guest speakers who talk to us about their life in politics and offer up opportunities for lively debates. We work withÂ our local Labour Party and our MP Cat Smith, to make our Labour Club a welcoming and engaging political hub, andÂ hold regular canvassing sessions and campaign training if you wish to get involved in upcoming elections.

So if you want to discuss politics, nominate a right-wing womble of the week or becomeÂ involved in campaigning for the Labour Party, come along to our Wednesday meetings, 5 pm in Fylde Common Room (opposite Fylde Bar), or get in touch via our Instagram @lancslabourclub. We will be very pleased to welcome you.Â 

The Club is completely open and accessible to all students at Lancaster, and also studentsÂ at the University of Cumbria.

name: Lacrosse - Women's+ and Mixed
description:
**![](https://www.facebook.com/LancsUniLaxClub/)Lancaster University Women's+ and Mixed Lacrosse Club**

Lancaster Universityâ€™s Womenâ€™s+ Lacrosse ClubÂ is a rapidly growing, inclusive club welcoming players of all abilities and experiences to the sport of lacrosse.Â 

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/498672/original/IMG_4899.jpeg)

**Womenâ€™s+ First Team 2022/23**

**Women's+ Lacrosse:**

Our Womenâ€™s+ clubÂ currently includes a 1stÂ team who compete the northern BUCS 2A League, and successfully finishedÂ 2nd in 2023, and a 2ndÂ team, who are aiming to enter BUCS very soon but for the momentÂ play semi-competitive matches throughout the year. Finally, we have a development squad who play intraclubÂ matches to improve abilities, whilst enjoying lacrosse more socially.Â 

On top of our Wednesday BUCS matches, weÂ compete in the war of the ROSES (Europeâ€™s biggest inter-university varsity sporting event) against the University of York with our 1stÂ team, 2ndÂ team and our Mixed Lacrosse team. We train twice weekly within the Womenâ€™s+ club on Thursdays and Sundays to improve our lax skills and fitness, and also haveÂ a separate weekly run that is encouraged to maintain stamina. Additionally, weÂ have strong ties to our lacrosse alumni and host a yearly alumni match to invite graduates back to the uni for a fun game of lacrosse. The Women's+ club runs as a sister club to the Lancaster Univesity Men's+ club, with mixed training and socials available for both clubs to attend.Â 

If you are brand new to the sport - don't worry! We start our training sessions from the beggining so you can build up the perfect foundation to become a lax pro. We will supply you with all the kit and equipment needed, so all you need are some sporty clothing, trainers, and a willingness to learn :))) We have a 2 week free trial until October 22nd 2023 and taster sessions on Saturday 7th October (2-4pm on 3G) and Sunday 8th October (4-6pm on 3G) if you want to come give it a go!Â 

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/498671/original/IMG_4577.jpeg)

**Womenâ€™s+ Second TeamÂ 2022/23**

**Mixed Lacrosse:**Â 

If you're interested in lacrosse but not too sureâ€¦ we have a mixed lacrosse training session weekly where anyone is welcome to come along and play lax. Our menâ€™s+, womenâ€™s+, and purely mixed members learn new skills each week and play tournaments throughout the year (as well as having a cheeky trip to Fylde for food after every mixed trainingÂ ïŠÂ ).

We also go to Liverpool to compete in a mixed lacrosse tournament, and play mixed competitively at ROSESâ€™s, so thereâ€™s always game opportunity if you want it. Our Mixed club is a less intense way to try lacrosse, and we encourage everyone to come try it out,Â regardless of ability. If youâ€™re thinking of coming to mixed, bring your friends and flatmates as everyone is welcome, and please feel free to message our Instagram @Lancaster\_Lax for any questions.Â 

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/472470/original/IMG_3988.jpeg)

**Mixed Team at the Liverpool Charity Tournament 2022**

**Socials:**Â 

Lacrosse isnâ€™t just a sport, itâ€™s a family for youÂ whilst youâ€™re at Lancaster University and beyond your graduation! We host weekly socials which are a fun way to way to bond as a club and integrate with our menâ€™s+ members. These occur on a Wednesday after our matches, with themes being released at the start of term. Previous themes have included Dynamic Duos, Olympics, Charity shop, the Wedding social, and much moreâ€¦

Whether you love a good drink, or are completely sober, everyone is welcome at our socials and there is never any pressure to consume alcohol.Â Additionally, we are committed to all our members wellbeing and understand that an evening social isnâ€™t everyoneâ€™s idea of fun, so we also host multiple fully sober socials throughout the year too! One example - and a festive favourite -Â includes our ice skating social which occurs right before the Christmas break.

Finally, we have two formal nights at Christmas and at the end of Summer termÂ to celebrate our successes each season and commemorate our year as a club. These involve everyone dressing up and enjoying a 3 courseÂ meal together then heading off to bars and eventually ending the evening in a nightclub. They are often seen as one of the annualÂ highlights as we have an awards ceremony at the meal to celebrate some of our incredibly players on their hard work that season, so they definitely are not something to miss!

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Â Â Â  Â Â ![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/472473/original/IMG_5778.jpeg)

name: Lancaster University Scuba Divers
description:
Welcome to Lancaster Uni Scuba Divers
-------------------------------------

LUScubaÂ is the Scuba Divers' Society, offeringÂ diveÂ training and trips around the UK so you can experience life below the waves! Swim amongÂ ship wrecks, fish,Â seals and loads more as you learn skills and build friendships. Check us out on social media, or email us a question if you want to know more.

#### [![Instagram Logo](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a5/Instagram_icon.png)@luscuba](http://www.instagram.com/luscuba)

#### [![Facebook Logo](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/0/05/Facebook_Logo_%282019%29.png)Lancaster Uni Scuba Divers](https://www.facebook.com/groups/luscuba)

#### [![Icon for Email](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/c/ce/Android_Email_8.1_Icon.png)subaqua.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk](mailto:subaqua.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk)

#### [![BSAC Logo](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/489199/original/BSAC_logo_blue.jpg)Join BSAC](http://www.bsac.com/membership/)

_**New to Diving**_
-------------------

No Problem! Every yearÂ we run the BSAC Ocean Diver Course for new divers, which includes theory lessons and practical diveÂ training sessions in swimming pools and in open water, at Capernwray Quarry.Â This course is suitable for everyone, even if you've never dived before, andÂ is run by experienced divers who hold BSAC Instructor Qualifications.Â 

We also offer Try Dives to anyone who is unsure if they would enjoy diving. Try Dives are 30 minute diveÂ sessions held in a pool where you can have fun with the saftey of an instructor. [Email us for more information](mailto:subaqua.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk?subject=Try%20Dives&body=I%20am%20interested%20in%20a%20try%20dive%2C%20when%20is%20your%20next%20available%20session%3F)!

**_Already a Diver_**
---------------------

Brilliant!Â We [recognise SCUBA qualifications](http://www.bsac.com/already-a-diver/equivalent-bsac-qualifications/) no matter where or who you did them with, so you can already qualified to dive with us.Â You can also extend your qualifications with advancedÂ BSAC Courses, such as Sports Diver or Dive Leader. Get yourÂ [BSAC Student Membership](http://www.bsac.com/membership/), which gives youÂ diving insurance and other benefits, and dive with us today!

**LANCASTER UNIVERSITY WOMEN'S RUGBY UNION FOOTBALL CLUB**

If you want to be a part of an inclusive community on and off the pitch, are looking for team spirit or just want to try out rugby - then LUWRUFC is the club for you.

![](https://scontent.fman4-2.fna.fbcdn.net/v/t1.15752-9/386428836_1743259739474135_4791964939008478797_n.png?_nc_cat=108&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=ae9488&_nc_ohc=od4UPaJ8yXYAX8fZ37I&_nc_oc=AQlLM1CTFNHSw40r9oLevo3z3DS7qW5kQknf3-3aUCLjgYMWVry5ksPL91-TFzfS0gwssHOg0oIqc9OshRCJz1R8&_nc_ht=scontent.fman4-2.fna&oh=03_AdQD2y3uvd6l033t9bAviKNtYWMzCkYwg6scMrZLWeg58Q&oe=654C88C5)

Lancaster UniversityÂ Women's Rugby areÂ an inclusive diverse club, welcoming new players of all abilities and experience. We don't run trials, but instead offer taster sessions so that you decide if you are part of the club, not us. We will ensure there is a place for you in our club should you decide to join us.

Currently, we have 2Â teams thatÂ compete in BUCS League and Cup matchesÂ as well as an expanding development squad enrolled in the Allianz Inner Warrior league. We offer competitive matches at a range of levels to ensure you have the opportunity to play at the level you feel comfortable to.

However, being a part of the club is about so much more than just rugby. The club's focus isÂ on offering members greatÂ value for their time commitment and as such we have a number of opportunities that include: community volunteeringÂ with local schools, mentor systems to help you adapt and settle into both the club and University life as well as a diverse and exciting social offering. As a club we are proud to say that we do not engage in sponsorships with local bars and nightclubs, giving us the freedom to have our social events wherever and whenever we want. This allows us to provide a social offering aimed at all members and the flexibility to host our socials in venues that appeal to both drinkers and non drinkers alike. We have a big emphasis on wellbeing and vary our social events to ensure all members have the best time.Â  With designated wellbeing and health and safety officers, your welfare is our main priority.

Over the past few years the club has doubled down on efforts to expand and ensure that we are the most inclusive club on campus. This hard work was recognised by both the University and BUCS as the club was voted Lancaster University Club of The YearÂ and shortly after received the unexpected honour of being named BUCS Club of the Year for 2019, given to the best university sports club in the UK. More recently, in 2022, our club won University Team of the Year, our 1XV were Varsity Winners and we reached the BUCS National Trophy Final. Becoming Northern 2A champions in 2023, we are pushing for more and more great achievements in the future.

We hope you choose to join us and can't wait to welcome you into our family!

![](https://scontent.fman4-2.fna.fbcdn.net/v/t1.15752-9/384531588_702912078169762_5364599623278784750_n.jpg?_nc_cat=106&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=ae9488&_nc_ohc=yXQKl1EZaXwAX8bRuNP&_nc_ht=scontent.fman4-2.fna&oh=03_AdRKM43hd2-2jqDs7IpYW0Yg4plbLGFp8UEXEvsDEIMDHQ&oe=654C9259)

Monday:Â BUCS 1st & 2nd Team Training 18:30 - 20:30,Â 3G

Wednesday:Â 1XV &Â 2XV Fixtures, Pitches

Thursday: Road to Rugby Sessions 20:00 - 22:00, 3G

Friday: Full Club Training 16:30 - 18:30, 3GÂ 

Saturday/Sunday: Allianz Inner Warrior Series Fixture (Development Team), Pitches

Sunday:Â Performance Squad Training 19:30 - 21:00, 3G

![](https://scontent.fman4-1.fna.fbcdn.net/v/t1.15752-9/384531677_336603435411315_764163043020569986_n.jpg?_nc_cat=105&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=ae9488&_nc_ohc=Ja6Ou8U1ii4AX80vH-v&_nc_ht=scontent.fman4-1.fna&oh=03_AdStxRrmqTlzCsN7331XTNjHUlt7OMn1xagQxa0qRXTWiw&oe=654C7CA4)

name: Law Society
description:
The Law Society is proudly one ofÂ the largest society on campus with membership wellin the hundreds!

We endeavour to provide our members with a high-class service that offers a wide variety of opportunities for students to gain an amalgamation of traits that will help them, both at University and then on in their careers, whether that is in the legal sector or not.

Each year we offer our members events that will provide them with the skills for success. We aim to guide our members through their time at University by helping them reach their maximum potential. Some of our events have an academic focus such as our Mooting, Negotiations and External Competitions as well as our Pro Bono Week which focuses on providing members with an opportunity to engage in volunteer programmes whilst at the same time developing their CV.

However, whilst we have a strong career focus which is emphasised through the events aforementioned, as well as those hosted by our Careers and Academic officers, which provide students with opportunities to network with practitioners and professionals alike in their chosen area, we also host a variety of other activities that are more socially focused to keep our members entertained throughout the year, such as our annual Law Ball and not to forget our netball and a football teams.

For more information about us, and how you can join our Law Society, see our website and our social media platforms which are linked below.

Facebook: www.facebook.com/LancasterUniversityLawSociety

Linkedlnr: Lancaster University Law Society

name: Barbell
description:
Welcome to LUBarbell!
=====================

We are a community of people passionate about all things strength sports, whether that's powerlifting, Olympic weightlifting, bodybuilding or just general gym training. We train in the strength and conitioning room of the Lancaster University Sports Center and everyone is welcome to join provided they have a membership/day pass to the gym.

We offer a range of membership options to suit all experience levels, from showing you the basics on your first ever gym session to providing support at national competitions. These options are:

### Social/Standard Membership

This membership tier is perfect for those more focused on the community element of Barbell and provides:

*   Access to general group chats
*   Access to our Sunday group training session
*   Access to all socials

### Development Membership

This membership tier is aimed at those looking to take their training to the next level and improve their lifting. As well as the benefits of the social membership, this tier provides:

*   Access to the development team group chat
*   Access to any additional development training sessions/workshops
*   Access to development programming/coaching
*   Access to a bank of powerlifting, Olympic weightlifting and bodybuilding resources and programs
*   Free entry to internal, varsity and roses meets/competitions

### Performance Membership

This membership tier is designed for those who are interested in the more competitive side of the strength sports. With this memberhsip you get everything mentioned previously, plus:

*   Access to the competitor group chat
*   Free travel to selected external meets
*   Meet day handling/coaching at selected external meets; including BUCS
*   Access to more specialised programming

Keep an eye on our social media for information about taster sessions we will run throughout the Freshers period. We can't wait to meet you all soon!

name: Hiking Club
description:
Â Â LUHC is one of the largest and oldest societiesÂ at Lancaster with more than 400 members and membership open to anyone all year round. We organise hiking trips and socials for every term week. We mostly visit the Lake District and the Yorkshire Dales using hired transport, but we frequently venture to Scotland and Wales for fun weekend trips too! Every Monday we meet in a different pub either in town or on campusÂ at 8:30pm, with many other socials planned throughout the year. We have more information available on our website including [information about equipment](https://luhc.org.uk/info/what-to-bring/).Â If you have any questions or queries do not hesitate to contact us through our Facebook or email (links below).

General Calendar:

*   Every **Monday at 8:30pm** we have a **pub social** in a different location around Lancaster
*   We haveÂ **Sunday trips** most weeks, and try to get in at least one Saturday per term for those who can't make Sundays; these day trips cost Â£12.50
*   We try to host our **weekend-long trips** about 3 times per term, and these generally costÂ Â£40 -Â Â£50
*   [Planned trips can be found here](http://luhc.org.uk/calendar/), and the [next few trips can be booked here](https://bit.ly/LUHCEvents).

name: Rugby Union - Men
description:
**LANCASTER UNIVERSITY RUGBY UNION FOOTBALL CLUB**

Lancaster University Rugby Union Football Club \[LURUFC\] is one of the largest and most socially active groups on campus. We pride ourselves in our professionalism on the pitch and the atmosphere we create around the club. The club is one of only a few to be a â€˜focus sportâ€™, which provides us with great support and access to resources such as coaching. As a result, we are able to support 3 team and a flourishing college system.Â 

All three sides compete in weekly BUCS fixtures against other universities.Â All teamsÂ also compete in the annual varsity competition, Roses, against York and the games never fail to draw a large crowd. Last year we had a historic roses, with a clean sheet across all three games.Â 

We are a club for all abilities and in order to cater for that we have a development pathway which starts with our weekly touch rugby 7s. This allows us to provide regular rugby for those who are just starting or are looking to get back into the sport and help to improve development to move up the teams, and there are multiple examples of this.Â 

As a club we also pride ourselves on having great fun off the field as well as success on it. Joining the club is a great way to meet people, all with a love for the game of rugby and make some great friends as well. We also have wellbeing sessions to help everyone through the more difficult times we all go through at university. By joining you will become part of a lifelong community filled with great people.Â 

If you have any questions, donâ€™t hesitate to ask by email or through the social media outlets and we will get back to you as soon as possibleÂ 

**Our Training Schedule:**

Mondays: 20:30 - 22:00 (on the 3g pitch)

Wednesdays: Game day

Fridays: 14:00 - 15:30 (on the 3g pitch)

Sundays: 10:00 - 12:00 (on the rugby pitches)

**Facebook:**Â [https://www.facebook.com/LancasterRugby/](https://www.facebook.com/LancasterRugby/)

**Twitter:**Â [https://twitter.com/LancasterUniRFC](https://twitter.com/LancasterUniRFC)

name: Football - Men
description: LUMFC represents the highest standard of Menâ€™s Football across the University and competes against other regional Universities within the Northern BUCS conference. Whilst being one squad LUMFC has two competitive teams, trials for which are each year during freshers week. All students are welcome to participate in trials, even if they are past or mature students. We train on Mondays and Thursdays, holding a strength and conditioning session on Sundays. Key benefits of joining LUMFC include representing the University, competing in Roses, joining an outstanding alumni network, and being involved in an exceptional social scene. LUMFC is funded by LUSU but managed by students.

We welcome people from all degree backgrounds to join us in exploring the wide-ranging field of Economics and bring to light some of the most current and exciting research. We believe that making friends with your classmates, outside the classroom, really improves your university experience and makes revising and concept-learning so much more productive and enjoyable. That's why we encourage you to join our social and sports teams!  
  
We believe strongly in helping the community around us and supporting students in whichever way useful. Please reach outs with any suggestions that you may have. See you at the next event!
