name: Trampolining
description:
Â **Lancaster University Trampolining Club**
===========================================

**Our Club**

At Lancaster University Trampolining ClubÂ we cater to all abilities.Â Trampolining is an all-inclusive sports team, meaning you don't need any prior experience to be welcomed into the club.Â Sessions allow members to work at their own pace.

**Our Exec**

Our Executive are there to answer any questions you may have about the club,Â competitions or socials - don't hesitate to reach out! We want everyone to feel involved and have fun at our club; if you have any issues or need someone to talk to you can reach out to our Welfare Officers.Â More information on our exec membersÂ can be found on our instagram page (@lancastertrampolining)

**Training**
------------

Training will now take place at the Lancaster University Sports Centre once a week during term time.Â 

Our coach has a Level 2 coaching qualification and isÂ able to coach up to Ball Outs and Codys.Â 

There will be two sessions taking place on **Tuesday** evenings, of which you will be able to choose **one** to attend:

**6:45-8:15**

or

**8:15-9:45**

In order to attend training sessions throughout the term, both a club membership and a Lancaster University Sports Centre membership will need to be purchased.Â 

Club memberships costÂ **Â£25** andÂ these are available by clicking 'join this group' on this page.

Lancaster Sport memberships can be purchased from the sports centre.

Before you attend your first session please ensure you have filled out theÂ [Health and Safety Form](https://form.jotformeu.com/80056975909368)

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/427911/original/Training.jpg)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Competitions**
----------------

We take part in NEUT (Northern English Universities Trampolining) League, BUCS (British Universities and Colleges Sport), invitational competitions and, of course, Roses, our huge annual sporting competition againstÂ York University.

All members are encouraged to compete in as many competitions as possible, available for all levels. This includes NEUT League competitions, Roses andÂ friendly competitions.Â 

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/427916/original/Roses_2022_Team_Photo.jpg)![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/427914/original/Competition.jpg)

**Socials**
-----------

We have regular socials which all members are welcome to attend.Â They are a great opportunity to get to know other members of the club and make some new friends!

There are a mixture of themed drinking and non-drinking socials. Even at drinking socials, there is no pressure to drink!Â 

Some of our socials include the kit social, trampolympics and a 'Beat the Exec' quiz. We also have an annual end of year awards meal!

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/427918/original/Kit_Social_2022.jpg)

_Image from our kit social._

**More Info**
-------------

If you want to find out more about the club, you are more than welcome to contact us through our social media platforms or send us an email at [trampolining.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk](mailto:trampolining@lancaster.ac.uk).

Our BloggerÂ website also hasÂ information regarding training, awards, competitions, results, and executive committee members.Â [http://lancastertrampolining.blogspot.com/](http://lancastertrampolining.blogspot.com/)

For a brief overview of the club, give our [2020Â promo video](http://tiny.cc/lutc) a watch!

[![Facebook](https://www.brandeps.com/logo-download/F/Facebook-logo-vector-01.svg)](https://www.facebook.com/LancasterUniversityTrampoliningClub)[![Instagram](https://www.brandeps.com/logo-download/I/Instagram-Icon-logo-vector-01.svg)](https://www.instagram.com/lancastertrampolining/)[![Twitter](https://www.brandeps.com/logo-download/T/Twitter-logo-vector-01.svg)](https://twitter.com/lutrampolining)

name: Climate Action
description:
Lancaster University Climate Action Society (LUCAS) offers a community to like-minded students who wish to engage in learning more about the climate crisis whilst offering a fun and friendly community where they can meet new people.

We will be running educational events such as climate talks by professionals, friendly debates and discussions, as well as promotion of things we can all do to reduce our environmental impact.

As well as this we will also be organising social events such as film and quiz nights. We will also be volunteering in beach and campus clean-ups, as well as tree planting to ensure we are looking after our local community.

If this is something you would be interested in, feel free to come along and all ideas are welcome! If you have any questions, email us at **[lancuniclimateaction@gmail.com](mailto:lancuniclimateaction@gmail.com)**Â orÂ **[climateaction.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk](mailto:climateaction.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk)**Â 

You can also find us on Facebook and Instagram! :)

Social Media

* * *

*   Facebook â€“ Lancaster University Climate Action Society â€“ LUCAS
*   Instagram - luclimateactionsociety

name: Tennis
description:
**Competitive Play** - We currently have 2 men's teams and 1 women's team who compete in the BUCS league and cup. We trainÂ 2 x per weekÂ and enjoy BUCSÂ matches on Wednesday afternoons. Membership is only required for those students who have trialed and been formally invited to join the team. More info on competitive tennis: [@lutctennis](https://www.instagram.com/lutctennis/?hl=en-gb)

**Social Tennis**Â - Tennis for all abilities! 2 sessions per week: Thursday 5-7pm on campus (mixed ability session) and Thursday 4-7pm in townÂ (bookable slots by skill level). Balls, beginners rackets and court hire is covered. Memberships are Â£25 per term or you can 'pay as you play' for Â£2 per session. More info on social tennis: [@lutc\_social](https://www.instagram.com/lutc_social/?hl=en-gb) or on our [WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/GJSwSe5mk9UHWzMuQGKfD1?fbclid=PAAaZ6oOwIS4YazgE--cmM5HUKU_38XyiJPOCes8B9o1LrbN8AjVJ4Y9KalHw_aem_AYtDlsb4PTbEhhCvivWtiNgNtrayl6bcP6kMX2JfKX4L6jP1IaacP1ia-lgYxBfyTVM)

As of 2023/24 we are looking to form a development squad for those advanced players who just missed out on the team. More information will be announced throughout the year but if you are interested please let us know!Â 

In conjunction with the SU and Active Lancaster there is another sessionÂ everyÂ Thursday at 3-5pm on campusÂ for anyone to turn up and play. This will cost just Â£1 per session (pay at the Sports Centre) and is for anyone of any ability to come down and play.

name: Lancaster Marrow
description:
Lancaster Marrow is a UK Student-led organisation that works in collaboration with the Anthony Nolan Charity to help recruit potential bone marrow donorsÂ to the Stem Cell Register. We organise donor recruitment eventsÂ in the university and out in the community, and we attempt to raiseÂ money for such a noble cause!Â In short, we aim to help save lives.

If you would like to get involved and volunteer at our events please join our society and like our Facebook & Instagram page for updates!

[https://www.facebook.com/LancsMarrow/](https://www.facebook.com/LancsMarrow/)Â Â and Instagram [@lancastermarrow](https://www.instagram.com/lancastermarrow/?hl=en-gb)

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/158968/original/WhatsApp_Image_2018-06-08_at_19.27.03.jpeg)

name: Book Club
description:
Each month we have two books of the month â€“ a short and long choice, that are both optional to read, and are voted on by you, the members! We also have readalong group chats for each book that allows everyone to discuss the books as we go through the month. We run two socials per month â€“ a chill reading event for everyone to sit, and read their current book, and another fun event such as picnics and movie nights. We also have fortnightly Welfare Wednesdays in person for some midweek mindfulness.

Join us to make bookish friends :)Â 

Follow our social media and feel free to message us with any questions you may have.

Instagram: @lancsbookclub

name: Pool and Snooker
description:
Are you a fan of cue sports? Whether you're a regular player, or brand new to the sport and want to try something new now you're at Uni, cue sports is one of the easiest sports to get into as a novice and quickly pick up, but it's tricky to master! LUPSC is your home for all things cue-related on campus!

Â ![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/402806/original/Screenshot_2022-01-28_at_21.20.18.png)

Lancaster University is one of the very few Universities in the country that features a collegiate system, and with that comes some fierce rivalry in the form of inter-college bar sports. And perhaps the most entertaining and competitive of them all is pool! Every Monday and Tuesday night, starting from week 2Â and running right through to week 20, the colleges will face off against each other in three leagues (Men's A's, Men's B's andÂ Women's) to compete for the prestigious title of College Pool Champions.

Lancaster also has a thriving pub league that runs on Wednesday nights, starting from approximately mid October.Â The club shall beÂ fielding 4 teams again this year, with the A's competing in the 1st Division, the B's and C's competing in the 2nd Division and the Women's+ competing in the 3rd Division. Go andÂ check outÂ [their website](http://lancasterpoolleague.org.uk/)Â for more info!

Not only do we play 8-ball, but in the past few years we have also seen success in both 9-ball and Snooker competitions!

Joining LU Pool and Snooker is the first step in getting involved in the culture of bar sports. We'll give you all the info you need to get started, and will also run events alongside the college league, including:

*   Practice sessions, where you can get some coaching from some of the top players on campus
*   Socials, where you can get to knowÂ fellow pool players from across the Uni away from the tables
*   Intra-campus individuals competitions
*   Opportunities to represent the UniÂ across the country!

So, what are you waiting for? Get signed up, and you might find yourself being in next year's team photo with a medal to show off!

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/402764/original/Screenshot_2022-01-28_at_20.29.42.png)

Featured: Official FunÂ Team Photo from the 2021/22 academic year.Â 

[![](https://en.facebookbrand.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/FB-FindUsOnFacebook-printpackaging-2.png)](https://www.facebook.com/LancsUniPool/)

[Follow Instagram @LUPoolSnooker](http://www.instagram.com/lupoolsnooker/)

name: Lancaster University Refereeing Society
description:
This Society is dedicated to providingÂ the organisation of referees for the football leagues at Lancaster University, as well as BUCS and Roses fixtures. We offerÂ a supportive network for anyone who is involved in refereeing, and actively encourageÂ promotion. We can also help you to get qualified.Â 

Why referee?Â 

\- Keep fit

\- Get outdoors

\- Watch football

\- Climb the ladder

\- Earn moneyÂ 

\- Make friends

Some of our referees also play football in the college and recreational leagues - often this is a help and not a hindrance! We would encourage active players to get involved with refereeing. We are equally open to those who have not previously been involved in football, or have stopped playing for anyÂ reason.Â 

For more information, or to ask anyÂ questions, please email us at referees.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk or contact us on Facebook:Â [https://www.facebook.com/LURefSoc/](https://www.facebook.com/LURefSoc/).Â 

Instagram: @lurefsoc

name: UNICEF
description:
Right now, children are in danger. We will do whatever it takes until every child is safe. UNICEF is the world's leading organisation for children in over 190 countries.

UNICEF on Campus is a student initiative supporting the work of UNICEF (United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund) through both fundraising activities and awareness-raising events here at the University. UNICEF works to provide both emergency aid and long-term development projects to some of the world's most vulnerable children.  
  
UNICEF helps children receive the support, healthcare and education they need to survive the threats of childhood poverty - such as preventable diseases or malnutrition - and grow up to become healthy adults. If you are interested in making a difference in children's lives throughout the world, then come along and get involved!

After signing up on the Union Cloud, please like our Instagram page UNICEF On Campus - Lancaster University and join our group UNICEF LU Volunteers! Also, to take part inÂ our fantastic volunteering opportunities and events, youÂ need to get a UNICEF T-shirt!Â The T-shirts are a way for you to feel united with our team as well as to gain more awareness and increase our presence on campus.

UNICEF Instagram:Â unicef\_lu

UNICEF T-shirts: Â£8

UNICEF On Campus - Lancaster University:Â [https://www.facebook.com/uniceflancaster](https://www.facebook.com/uniceflancaster)

**Executive Committee (2023/24)**

**President -**Â Omar Ali Tariq

**Vice-President -**Â Abbas Hasan

**General Secretary -**Â Abdullah Ahmed

**Chief Information Officer -**Â Isaac HussainÂ 

**Volunteer's Director -**Â Adriana EzelynÂ 

**Events Coordinator -**Â Aliya Naqvi

**Social Media Manager -**Â Daniel Wright

**Liason Officer -**Â Selma Marouf

**Treasurer -**Â Haisam Tayyab

name: Japanese Society
description:
Lancaster University Japanese Society is a student society for anyone who:

â€¢ **Is interested in Japanese culture orÂ careers in Japan**

â€¢ **Wants to communicate with Japanese students at Lancaster University**

**All nationalities are welcome!**

We are a relaxed community aiming to share the culture, knowledge and experiences of Japan.

Members do not have to use Japanese, but there are opportunities to learn it!

We usually meet on **odd-week Thursdays** (i.e. week 1, 3, 5...).

For more information about our activities, please visit our **Instagram page** (user name: lujapanese)!

Information about careers in Japan is available on both ourÂ **Instagram** and **Facebook page** (link: https://www.facebook.com/lujapanese/).

We acceptÂ requests for specific activities and events to hold during our big Japanese Festival in term 2 :)

Please send us messages via Instagram.

name: Lancaster University Living History Society
description:
We are the Lancaster University Living History Society,Â a 12th Century historical re-enactment group.

We engage in a multitude of authentic crafts, from making our own decorated kit by hand, creating our own shields and armour, crafting our weapons, and cooking whilst on encampment.

Our combat features a variety of weaponry, from bows and crossbows, swords and spears, to glaives and axes. CombatÂ works on a hit point system so the outcome of a battle is never predetermined, leading to challenging and rewarding combat!

We also have opportunites for authentic 12th Century portrayals of church life and religion.

There is something for everybody in LULHS!

We hold craft sessions on Thursday evenings 7pm-10pm in Bowland North, usually in SR 23.

We train every Sunday (provided the weather is good) at Quernmore Park in LancasterÂ 11am-4pm, and every Wednesday in the Brandrigg Room on campus 1pm-6pm (the location may vary depending on the weather). If you fancy training with us we meet up before each session at AlexandraÂ Square, (the big stairs near Greggs, you can't miss us) before walking or catching the bus to training, make sure you check our Facebook page for details.

If you want to know more feel free to contact us via our Facebook page:

[https://www.facebook.com/LULHS/](http://www.facebook.com/LULHS/)

You can also find us on other social media:

Instagram: @lulivinghistorysociety

Twitter: LULivHisSoc

name: Lancaster STAR
description:
Whether you're interested in:

*   Politics and news surrounding the **Refugee Crisis**
*   **Human rights** and immigration law
*   Community **volunteering** and fundraising
*   Integration, **language education**, and teaching

... LUSTAR has something for you.

We work with the the STAR network (Student action for refugees) Students Union, local NGOs, and students to provide opportunities to asylum seekers and refugees. For the past fourÂ years we've engaged in a huge range of activities, including **music/dance evenings** with refugees DJing, campus **film nights** for families, **pool nights** in town, bringing refugees to the campus Prayer Rooms and Chaplaincy Centre for **prayers** and **religious celebrations**, **campaigning** the university to provide refugees with **scholarships**, collecting **donations** of clothing to take to **Calais**, and matching students with **language skills** to local NGOs, to provide **English lessons**.

We fund these activities through **bake sales** and **raffle stalls**, and have lots more planned for 2021-22, including more **music nights**!

We also share **news stories** and facts through our **social media**, and hold **talks** and **documentary** nights, so that you can stay informed on the matter.  
  
Take a look at our [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/Redroserefugees/),Â **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/LUredrose)**Â and [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lancaster_star/?hl=en) if you want to get involved!

Membership is currently **free!**

name: Railway Society
description:
We are the Lancaster University Railway Society, where those interested in railways can gather, talk, learn and get involved with the railway heritage scene. We work with heritage railway organisations to help deliver the best activities for our members, allowing for unforgettable experiences.

So why not join our growing community, socialise with like-minded people, and get involved in the fascinating heritage railway sector?

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/529477/original/IMG_7250.jpeg)![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/529478/original/IMG_6991.jpeg)![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/529480/original/IMG_6205.jpeg)

name: Archery
description:
Whether youâ€™re looking to emulate fictional heroes such as Robin Hood; or inspired by the Olympics to take up a competitive sport thatâ€™s slightly off the beaten track, we can cater to the whole range of interests. It doesnâ€™t matter if youâ€™ve never even touched a bow before as we will give you all the basic training youâ€™ll need to get going, as well as providing all necessary equipment. We offer free taster sessions at the start of each year where you can come and have a go. After that there's some compulsory coaching which will teach you all you need to know in order toÂ start shooting independently.

After this the membership cost is Â£30 for the year.Â This includes the use of all of the clubâ€™s equipment,Â affiliation to the national archery governing bodyÂ as well as further training and coaching. If you already have shooting experience then youâ€™ll only need to pay the Â£30 membership fee then you can jump right in!

**Please do not buy membership if you do not have a ticket to the beginner's course.**

**If you are not currently a student**, or you would prefer to buy ArcheryGB through your own means, please purchase the 'Non-AGB' membership. We are unable to insure non-students on the club's AGB.

**All clubs that use the sports centre require members to purchase a Sport Lancaster membership.** Please ask at the front desk to purchase this to ensure you get the correct one. You'll only need one and then you can join as many sports clubs as you like.

Please make sure to have a read of the [club rules](https://lancsarchery.files.wordpress.com/2023/10/luac-rules-2023.pdf). We also advise having a read over our constitution and other club documents before purchasing your membership, which can be found [here](https://lancsarchery.files.wordpress.com/2020/06/luac-constitution-2020.pdf)

Training & Coaching
-------------------

**Our current training times are:**

*   Monday: 15:00 - 17:00
*   Friday: 19:00 - 21:00

**Coaches:**

*   Vlada Priestman
*   Student coaches with Level 1 qualifications

Contact
-------

Feel free to contact us on our [Facebook Page](https://www.facebook.com/groups/363565477427946), our [Instagram Page](https://www.instagram.com/lancasteruniarchery),Â or [send us an email](mailto:archery.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk?subject=Archery%20query).

Be sure to join our [Facebook Group](https://www.facebook.com/groups/363565477427946) as well, in order to keep in contact with club members, and get the latest news on competitions, socials, and other fantastic stuff.

We also have an awesome [website](https://lancsarchery.wordpress.com/) for all your club needs.

name: Taiwanese
description:
Lancaster UniversityÂ **Taiwanese Student SocietyÂ (LUTSS)**Â is a student organisation at the Lancaster UniversityÂ dedicated to improvingÂ TaiwaneseÂ cultural awareness onÂ campus and in the Lancaster area.Â The purpose of LUTSS is not only toÂ help Taiwanese students to integrate in the UK, by organising a variety of activities from Christmas Social, Lunar New Year celebration toÂ BBQ social,Â film festival and career events, weÂ also promote TaiwaneseÂ culture by incorporating with the official, organization and business. We are hoping to increase the awareness of the rich culture and heritage of Taiwan, Taiwanese students, and Taiwanese scholars.  
  
Taiwan means many things to different people. Whether you've been to Taiwan before or have always been interested in Taiwanese culture, come check out LUTSSÂ to find out what Taiwan is really all about!Â LUTSS is a culturally-aware and diverse club. We collaborateÂ with other cultural clubs on campus, and it's a great way to get to meet new friends! The majority of our members are mainly Taiwanese students and scholars, however, we do welcome all friends to become aÂ LUTSSÂ member.Â You DO NOT have to be Taiwanese to join!

To know more about LUTSS, please go to:Â [http://www.facebook.com/LUTaiwanese/](http://www.facebook.com/LUTaiwanese/)

name: Women+ Forum
description:
**Our Upcoming Events;**

Details on our instagram!

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/468131/original/First_Term_Events.svg)

name: Shooting
description:
Hi, 2023-2024Â Students!

We hostÂ weekly shoots at the Crabtree Clay Pigeon Shooting Ground (roughly 20-minute drive) on Wednesdays and fortnightly, members-only, Saturday or Sunday shoots at varying grounds. We are a friendly and relaxed club in which all are welcome, no prior experience is necessary and all equipment is provided. Wednesday shoots meet outside Aldi in town at 13.15Â pm orÂ Bowland Avenue at 13:30 pm, and Saturday/Sunday shoot details TBC.

As mentioned, we are a relaxed club so it is not mandatory nor expected of you to attend each session!

To book onto a sessionÂ just send the club a Facebook or Instagram message.

All new shooters (with us) are required to take aÂ taster shoot costingÂ Â£35Â (includes transport, tuition, 25 clays and 25 cartridges). After completing a taster shoot you will be invited to purchase an annual society membership for Â£35 after which the rates for shooting will be significantly cheaper. Students currently in possession of a shotgun certificate are not required to complete a taster shoot and are able to shoot with their own cartridges if desired. A Â£10Â deposit is required before each session and is refundable from the session cost.Â Â 

Taster shoots can become booked up very quickly due to limited spaces so you may have to be bookingÂ up to 5 weeks in advance.

We shoot in several competitions across the country, including BUCS, throughout the year as well as hosting our own invitational competition, the Lancaster Cup, each year. Please see our Facebook and Instagram for more details and photos.

We shoot in all weathers so recommend members to dress appropriately similarly, please wear firm footware and bring a coat/gilet/fleece with deep and strong pockets to hold cartridges.Â 

It is our intention hold an informational talk at the beginning of the year but details TBC.

Facebook: [www.facebook.com/LUCPSC](https://www.facebook.com/LUCPSC/)

Instagram: [@lushooting](https://www.instagram.com/lushooting/)

President Contact Details: Luke Misra l.misra@lancaster.ac.uk

name: County Netball
description:
Hi! This is the pageÂ County Netball, a student-led netball team for those in County College. Whether you've never picked up a netball or have played for years, there's a spot for you in our club!

We have 5 teams, running in all 4 leagues, so if you are interested please message our instagram or join our facebook group!

Our training is Monday 5:30-7 and every other Wednesday 3-4.Â 

Please note this group is for County students only - if you are interested in joining netball all the colleges have a team so make sure to message them!

name: Lancaster University Netball Club
description:
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Â **Welcome to Lancaster University Netball Club**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/205928/original/LUNC.jpg)

Lancaster University Netball Club is a proudly all-female led club providing a highly competitive and friendly environment. We have a long-standing successful sports reputation at Lancaster University and are proud to be a University focus sport helping us build on our success and support us in creating a well-structured and intensive netball performance programme.

The success of each individual and the club is driven by the clubâ€™s core values â€“ teamwork and dedication. We look for passionate, enthusiastic and committed players to join our club and become part of the LUNC family. Our fantastic social scene of weekly socials and termly events leaves members with great memories both on and off the court.

Our three netball teams benefit from intensive training throughout the year and compete in the BUCS leagues and the all important annual Roses tournament against the University of York.

name: Students with Disabilities Forum
description:
We welcome any student with a chronic or mental health condition, neurodivergency, specific learning difficult (SpLD), or any other accessibility requirements. You don't have to personally identify or call yourself disabled.

Join to make new friends, enjoy fun socials and have your say about disabled life at our uni.

name: LU Whisky Society
description:
Are you interested in learning more about the whisky, the industry, how it's made as well as sampling many fabulous whiskies? Well maybe this is the society for you?Â 

We hold regular events and tastings as well as trips out and occasional distillery visits.

name: First Love Christian Society
description:
We are a vibrant and energetic group of young people, full of first love for the Lord!Â We believe it is imperative for every young person to know that **Jesus died for them**.Â 

Our society can be found in universities across the United Kingdom, and our motto is simple: **it is our duty to love God, and to love others**. Across the academic year, we host an array of exciting and creative events that all students are welcome to attend.Â 

We know that starting out at university can be hard with all the new faces, new places and new experiences. Nevertheless, First Love are here to make it one of the best chapters of your life yet! We offer fun, fellowship and above all, a family.

If you would like to join us and not sure how to, please send us an email and we will get back to you promptly!

For more information on our events, follow us on:

Instagram: **@firstloveuk** and **@firstlovelancaster**  
Â 

Like what youâ€™ve read? Why not join our WhatsApp group chat for regular updates.Â Give Tamika a call or message onÂ **+447949735570** we look forward to hearing from you! Alternatively, you can contact us on Instagram and someone will be in contact asap.

name: issue fashion society
description:
Issue is Lancaster University's fashion society. We are an all-inclusive team of students, who are looking to connect with others alike, explore the world of fashion business and have lots of fun along the way. We aspire to offerÂ all members the opportunities to express themselves through fashion, get creative, network with industry experts and make life long friends.Â 

We embraceÂ individuality and diversity.Â 

[instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lufashionsoc/)

name: Bowland Football
description: 2022/23 Division 1 and Roses Champions

name: Mountaineering Club
description:
Welcome to theÂ Lancaster University Mountaineering Club!

Whether it be rock climbing, bouldering, winter climbing, ghyll scrambling,Â hiking or more, we do our very best to adventure far and wide!Â If youÂ alreadyÂ climb, or just fancy giving it a go,Â then we're the society for you. We're happy toÂ take people of all abilities, and accept new members all year round.

With sessions at the Uni wall, bouldering evenings, and day trips outdoors each weekÂ along with fornightly socials and termly weekend trips, there is more than enough to keep you occupied, just come along and see!Â Becoming a member lets you borrow gear, get instruction in climbing safely, and most importantly makes you part of the best family at the university!Â 

To getÂ involved: once you've got your membership,Â **join our facebook**Â [LUMC](https://www.facebook.com/groups/2015928578717349/)Â and message an admin to be added to our groupchat for the year!

If you have any questions at all just email the exec and we will be happy to help.

  
_â€œThe BMC recognises that climbing, hill walking and mountaineering are activities with a danger of personal injury or death. Participants in these activities should be aware of and accept these risks and be responsible for their own actions and involvement.â€_

*   Email:Â lumcclimbing@gmail.comÂ Â 
*   Website:Â [www.lumc.org.uk/](http://www.lumc.org.uk/)
*   Facebook Group:Â [LUMC](https://www.facebook.com/groups/2015928578717349/)
*   Important links:Â [linktree](https://linktr.ee/LUMountaineeringClub)

Â ![Photos of members of the club, surrounding the LUMC logo](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/445597/original/759EFC12-5799-493F-8134-1124C24C2D0A.png)

name: Indonesian Society
description:
1.  President and Vice President electionÂ

3.  Monthly socials open to non-member

5.  Annual General Meeting
6.  Exciting projects with Indonesian society outside Lancaster University

There will be lots of fun, food and party waiting for you and your friends! xx

name: Biology Society
description:
Are you interested in the Biosciences? Would you like to take part in social activities with like-minded people, learn more about bio-related research at Lancaster University and learn about career paths and opportunities?

BioSoc is a science society welcoming all students with interest in biosciences (you do not have to be a biology student to be a member)! We organise academic and career talks to give you the opportunity to learn more about bio-related research and careersÂ at Lancaster University and beyond! We also host numerous socials throughout the year including bio-themed quizzes, collabortions with other societies, end of term mealsÂ and nights out!Â 

Follow our social media pages and feel free to message us if you have any questions:

Instagram: @lubiosoc

Facebook:Â [LU Biology Society | Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/LUBioSoc2020)

name: Squash
description:
**About Us**

We are the Lancaster University Squash Club! Whoever you are and whatever your ability, come and have a go at this unique sport!Â Our society has 89Â active members, and we encourage anyone to join us at our regular training, socials, meals and trips! So come alongÂ and get to knowÂ fellow squash players - everyone isÂ invited!

**Competitive Players**

**The BUCS Squad**

For thoseÂ who wish to play squash competitively, we operate three teams within the BUCS (British Universities & Colleges Sport) leagues, where you can proudly represent Lancaster University Squash ClubÂ and battle it out against other universities across the North-West.Â With 2 Men's teamsÂ and 1 Women's teamÂ playing on Wednesday afternoons, there is plenty of space for all those interested in attending try-outs at the beginning of the year. The BUCS Squad is made up of 18 people (6 individuals for eachÂ 5-person team). Training occurs on Sunday and Monday evenings every week, coached by Josh Taylor (Ex-England Squash Coach, currently coaches Patrick Rooney #WR20 and works for the Professional Squash Association). The Men's 1stÂ team play in Division 1A Northern, the Men's 2ndÂ in Division 2A Northern and the Women's 1st inÂ Division 2A Northern.Â 

**Regional Leagues**

We have two teams competing in the North-West Counties Squash League ([https://www.nwcsl.org/](https://www.nwcsl.org/))! Playing on Thursday evenings, alternating between home and away games,Â individuals in the Regional Leagues teams have the opportunity to gain further match experience, test themselves out against different styles of squash, and enjoy time on the road with their fellow teammates!Â 

The 1st team plays in Divsion 3Â Central, and the 2nd team plays in Division 4Â Central North.

**Roses**

Once a year, Lancaster University faces off against its biggest rival - York University. Taking place in Summer Term, teams from across the two universities compete inÂ **Roses**, the biggest inter-university tournament in Europe. In 2022, we smashed York, and are looking to do it again in 2023!

**Men's and Women's Development Squad**

For keen squash players of all abilities or just for people who are interested in getting into the sport, we runÂ **The**Â **Development Squad**. There are threeÂ Men's and one Women's squad. Training once a week (different times for each squad),Â led by members of the Club Executive Committee, the Development Squad offers the opportunity to improve your game, play people of your skill level, and get involved with frequent competitions!Â It is also an excellent way for players to challenge for BUCS Squad positions in the future, or to earn an invitation to train with the teams if appropriate.

**Membership Prices.**

**BUCS member**: Â£80

**College Squash Membership**: Â£55

**Development Squad member** (1 year): Â£40Â 

**Development Squad member** (1 term): Â£20

NOTE: for information about gym memberships, from prices to what's included, see the Lancaster University Sports Centre website [here](https://www.lancaster.ac.uk/sport/sports-centre/membership/).

**Social Media**

Please don't hesitate to follow us or get in contact with us!

You can find us on:

Facebook as Lancaster University Squash Club ([https://www.facebook.com/lusquash/](https://www.facebook.com/LUSQUASH/))Â 

On our new websiteÂ [https://lusquash.com/](https://lusquash.com/)Â 

Follow us on Instagram at [@lusquash](https://www.instagram.com/lusquash/)

Or email us at [lancasteruniversitysquashclub@gmail.com](mailto:lancasteruniversitysquashclub@gmail.com).

name: Nigerian Society
description:
Ekabo! We are Lancaster University's Nigerian Society and our main purpose is to bring together students who are interestedÂ inÂ Nigerian culture.Our society is a great way to learn more about and celebrate the many diverse tribes that make Nigeria unique.

We will be hosting numerous events throughout the year such asÂ themed parties, games nights, educational panels, cooking classes and movie nights so that all our members can socialise and get toÂ know each other.

You are welcome to join us for a year filled with food, events and meeting new people!

Feel free to follow us on all our social media accounts

Instagram: @nsoclancaster

Twitter: @LancasterNsoc

Snapchat: @Lancaster\_nsoc

name: 93% Club Lancaster
description:
The 93% Club was founded at the University of Bristol in 2016 and has since expanded to become the UKâ€™s largest **social mobility** network for students across 45+ universities.Â 

### We exist because 93% of the UK population go to state schools, yet state-educated professionals only make upâ€¦ 35% of Senior Judges, 43% of the House of Lords, 56% of Journalists, 48% of Junior Ministers, 34% of FTSE 350 CEOs, 41% of Permanent Secretaries.

### **Itâ€™s time to close the gap.**

Joining The 93% Club enables you to attend all of our events and become part of our movement. We provide our members with professional development and soft skill workshops, speaker events, networking opportunities, educational resources and a social space to connect with like-minded students.Â 

Our aim is to equip our members with the personal and professional skills they need to make meaningful, informed career choices and get the most out of their time at university. By creating a space for these students to share their experiences, concerns, questions and resources, The 93% Club aims to ensure that all students, regardless of their educational background, have the same positive academic and social experiences.

At Lancaster University, we hope to run insightful events in a variety of sectors, as well as exclusive coaching opportunities, and various networking events with Alumni and Recruiters.

Sign-up now!

To find out more, please visit www.93percent.club/

description:
We are the Lancaster Chinese Christian Fellowship (å…°å¡åäººåŸºç£å¾’å›¢å¥‘) at Lancaster University, an independent Christian student group. Join us if you are interested in coming along to an event or are coming to Lancaster in the future!

name: Baking Society
description:
Here's some food for thought:Â why not join a society that'll get you brownie points with your flatmates? We bake a range of sweet and savoury treats, try out new cafes around Lancaster, watch GBBO together and have lots of relaxedÂ socials!

Membership for each term will cost Â£3, however, if you buy an annual membership for the whole yearÂ it is only Â£6.Â It then costs just Â£2.50 for every bake that you sign up for, although special events and workshops may cost slightly more.Â Baking sign up will be launched on Saturday afternoon and is accessed through the Student's Union website. So just bring yourself and a containerÂ along on a Saturday to Fylde Common Room - we supply the recipe, equipment and ingredients.Â 

No matter your level of baking skills come and give us a go!Â 

Like our Facebook (Lancaster University Baking Society)Â and/or InstagramÂ page (@lubakingsociety)Â to keep up to date on upcoming bakes and socials and we hope to see you there :)

name: Harry Potter Society
description:
Hey everyone, we're the Lancaster Harry Potter Society! We are CLEARLY the coolest and best society Lancaster University has to offer! We are for people who love a bit of Potter goodness in their lives (a fun mix of hardcore fans and those who are more casual and lighthearted in their interest) and wants to have a bit of fun! Our events include Horcrux hunts around campus, quizzes on the books and films, triwizard tasks and crafting nights!

General information will be on our Facebook andÂ Instagram, follow us @LUPotterSocÂ 

See you there Potterheads!

name: Catholic Society
description:
**Lancaster University Catholic Society** (CathSoc)

We are a community of students growing in knowledge and understanding of the Catholic faith, either as members of the Catholic Church or as interested parties. We seek to foster community and friendship through our broad range of activities, such as:

\- Holy Mass in our Roman Catholic Chapel on Sundays at 17.30Â and Wednesdays at 18.00

\- Adoration of the Blessed Sacrament from 17.00 - 18.00 on Wednesday

\- Sacrament of Reconciliation (Confession) availableÂ from 17.00 - 17:20 on Sundays and 17:00-17:45 on Wednesdays

\- Wednesday night socials from 19.00Â in the Catholic Flat, ranging from talks by special guest speakers and social events.

\- Local walks and weekend retreats to various locations.

\-Â Â Breakfast Club at 08.00 every Thursday Morning; preceded by the RosaryÂ in the RC Chapel.

\- Termly trips to residentials and city breaks.

A calendar will be released detailing events and all events will be posted on our InstagramÂ page.

**Everybody**Â is welcome to join the Catholic Society, a social, or Mass! We are here for all students of all faiths and none to encourage them in their studies through our faith.

Instagram: [@](https://www.instagram.com/lucatholicsoc/)lancathsoc

Facebok:Â https://.facebook.com/lanCathSoc

You can always email us with any queries at lucatholicsociety@gmail.com or send us a DM on Instagram.

**2023/24Â Exec Committee:**

**President: Owen Warner**

**Secretary: Jack Benyon**

**Social Secretary: David Leal-Silva**

name: RocSoc
description:
If you like music of the rock/metal/punk/alternativeÂ variety, enjoy making friends, and like local music scenes,Â we're probably the society for you. We hold weekly socials where our DJs play your requests, show you the best rock nights in Lancaster, offer termly trips to larger rock clubs in other cities and put on gigs just for members! A RocSoc membership also gives you reduced local gigs, and a discount on draught drinks and soft drinks at the Pub!

This year we have an active and jam packed calendar, with themed events, collaborations and even aÂ karaoke session! Want to find out more? Give the Facebook page a message and one of our lovely exec will be happy to answer any queries!Â

Lancaster Univeristy's home for tabletop and LARP!
==================================================

We offer a place for both new, casual and veteran players, so donâ€™t worry if youâ€™ve never role-played before or have 10+ years under your belt. Everyone is welcome!  
  
LURPS holds many opportunities throughout the year for both table-top and LARP. We have tabletop games running through all terms, Tuesdays and Thursdays evenings. We also host several LARP systems, working on an alternating schedule each weekend.  
  
For those that can't commit to a campaign or want to try LURPS out, we hold termly socials and one-shots throughout the year, which are free for all to attend!Â   
  
We also have a DiscordÂ where you can chat, meetÂ members and organiseÂ table-top games outside of our meeting times. So, if you just want to chat, get advice on roleplay or hang out with friends, LURPS has it all!  
  
Membership is **Â£3 a year**, and this will go towards financing our website, socials as well as a chance for us to sell merch and buy supplies for the society!  
  
For more information on the society visit our website at [https://sites.google.com/view/lurps/lurps](https://sites.google.com/view/lurps/lurps "https://sites.google.com/view/lurps/lurps")  
  
Follow our socials for news, pics and more!

**_LANCASTER UNIVERSITY BASKETBALL MEN'SÂ SOCIETY_**

Welcome to Lancaster University Basketball Men's Society's page. We provideÂ the highest order of men's basketball for all Lancaster University affiliates. Currently withÂ two teams;Â 1st Team competing in BUCS (British Universities & Colleges Sport) Men's Northern Tier 3A League and a newly introduced 2nd Team, with ourÂ 1st team also competing in the BUCS Men's Northern Conference Cup, we welcome ALL levels of skill/play, beginner or not, experience or NO experience, EVERYBODYÂ is WELCOME! We also aim to provide opportunities for ALL interested in basketball, competitive or not; recreational sessions, scrimmages, 3v3 tournaments, college leagues, intra-university friendly games, etc.

Furthermore, our teams get to compete in the Roses Tournament (TheÂ **Roses Tournament**Â is an annual sports competition betweenÂ [Lancaster University](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lancaster_University "Lancaster University")Â and theÂ [University of York](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_of_York "University of York")Â in England, often described as the largest inter-university sports tournament in Europe - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roses\_Tournament).

**Membership**

Collected membership fees go to developing basketball and basketball experience(s) for all at the university. _**You do not need to be a player on any of our teams to be a member of the society!**_

name: Swimming and Waterpolo
description:
**Welcome to LUSWP- Lancaster University Swimming andÂ Water Polo Club! ğŸŒ¹**

About Us

We are a lively, friendly, outgoing clubÂ which allows its members to compete in both swimming and water polo. LUSWP was voted Lancaster University Student's Union club of the year in 2016 andÂ 2017, and we continue to be one of the largest sports clubs at Lancaster.

Swimming

In swimming we compete in BUCS short and long course as well as the BUCS team champs. On top of this we also compete in an inter-university league called BUSL, as well as multiple charity competitions such as Duel in the Pool (against Leeds), and Quest for the Crest (held in Manchester). These provide additional competing opportunities forÂ our members. We have a dedicated swimming coach, Stu Horton, who has been with us for several years, and has helped us to produce and develop one of the most exciting performance swimming programmes out there right now.

Waterpolo

In Water Polo we compete in BUCS league and BUCS cup as well as in UPOLO, which is an additional league for match practice. On top of this our Patnership with Lancaster City Swimming andÂ Water Polo Club allows our members to train with GB athletes and receive further coaching andÂ training. We have a strong water polo coachingÂ setup, with our lead mentorÂ Andy Wilson havingÂ coached the Scottish Women's National Team.

**Many members take up competitive swimming and water polo for the first time at university and we encourage everybody to give both sports a try regardless of previous experience.**Â 

CompetitionsÂ 

The pinnacle of our sporting calender, which we work towards all year, is Roses -Â our varsity competition againstÂ York University. Usually taking place over the May bank holiday weekend this is not an event to be missed. Roses is the largest varsity sports tournament in Europe, and we'd love to have you join our team!Â 

Overall, we offer a wide range of opportunities to get involved in our sport! We have dedicated performance and development squads for both swimming and water polo, and this allowsÂ as many people as possible to get involved.

Contact Us

**Visit our website [http://www.luswp.co.uk](http://www.luswp.co.uk)Â  Â |Â  Â Email us [luswp@outlook.com](mailto:luswp@outlook.com)Â  Â | Watch our [Introductory Video](https://www.facebook.com/LUSwimPolo/videos/2442694212617374/)Â  Â |Â Â Find us on Instagram @LUSWPÂ  Â |Â  Â Follow us on Facebook @Lancaster University Swimming and Water Polo**

**Membership andÂ Training**

Membership Prices for the 23-24Â Season are:

*   Â£100Â for Performance Swimmng
*   Â£100 forÂ Performance Water Polo
*   Â£80 for Development Swimming
*   Â£75Â for Development Water Polo
*   Â£25 for Recreational Swimming
*   Â£5 for Keep Connected/Social membership

**Training Times for 2023-24**

Performance Water Polo:Â  Â Tuesday 8 â€“ 10pm (Salt Ayre), Wednesday 11.30-1.15pm, Thursday 8-9:30pm (Salt Ayre), Friday 7.30-10pm (Salt Ayre), Saturday 4:30-6pmÂ 

Development Water Polo:Â  Â Â Wednesday 11:30-1.15pm,Â Thursday 8-9.30pm (Salt Ayre), Saturday 4:30-6pm.

Performance SwimmingÂ Squad:Â  Â  Monday 8-10pm, Tuesday 6-8pm, Wednesday 6am-7:30am, Thursday 7:30-9:30pm, Friday 7:15-9:15pm.

DevelopmentÂ SwimmingÂ Squad:Â  Â  Tuesday 8-10pm, Thursday 6-7:30pm, FridayÂ 7am-8am.

name: Real Ale and Cider Society
description:
Lancaster University Real Ale and Cider Society is a warm and welcoming society full of vibrant people from all academic disciplines. Our unifying trait is our love for a good beer or cider in a proper pub whilst in good company! We will show you all the brilliant drinking spots of Lancaster where you can enjoy a pint of quality real ale, craft beer or cider. We also visit breweries, attend festivals, hold tastings and have many more social events throughout the year!

Membership is Â£1 for the whole year, discounts pending!

Every Tuesday we meet on campus outside Costa at around 7pm and can be found in the pub for that week from 7:30pm. For on-campus bars, we meet in the venue at 7:30pm.

name: Lancaster University Speleological Society: Caving
description:
Welcome to LUSS, Lancaster University's caving club!

The society has existed since 1967Â and was once the most prestigious in the UK with many caving credits to its name.Â Until the 1980s, LUSS was very active in original explorations in the Yorkshire Dales, the eastern Picos of Spain (where they explored SimaÂ 56 to a depth of 1169â€¯m), Venezuela, and otherÂ locations. It also did some valuable scientific work. Its alumni include Colin Boothroyd, Dave Checkley, John Gardner, and Mel Gascoyne, and in its earlier years it was mentored by Dick Glover.

During its active period it produced four very fine journals which are now difficult to get hold of. It is worth noting that good quality images of the Yorkshire surveys published byÂ LUSS, including those published with the journals, are available on theÂ [Cavemapper](http://cavemaps.org/luss.htm)Â website.

We areÂ on the lookout for moreÂ experienced and inexperienced members!

In addition toÂ caving,Â we runÂ socials throughout the year ranging from bouldering to ice skating in the winter.

If you areÂ interested in joining us, please come along to our beginner sessions! If these suit you, we will be running abseiling and SRT practice sessions at regular intervals throughout the year.

Find us on Facebook:Â [Lancaster University Speleological Society](https://www.facebook.com/groups/1933676873324193/)

Find us on Instagram: [@luss\_caving](https://www.instagram.com/luss_caving/?hl=en-gb)

Email us:Â [speleological.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk](mailto:hiking.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk)

name: Lancaster University Accounting Society
description:
**The Accounting Society is the place for you to boost employability skills, network and enhance your Accounting knowledge.**

We have two simple objectives as a society â€“ to increase studentsâ€™ accounting employability and enhance accounting academic skills. We welcome students from any degree discipline to join our society and hope that our insightful events and academic support sessions aid you in choosing an appropriate future accounting position.

This year, we are proud to have increased our collaborationÂ with an arrary of firms, including RSM, Azets, CIMA, ICAEW, + many more.

We are also thrilled to continueÂ our **Insight Series** - a succesfulÂ initiative of ours which aims to increase the number of students securing Accounting-related Internships / Placements. Our Insight Series will feature students who have secured internship and placements, who will offer relatable advice and tips.

The **Insight series** will include:

*   Application advice sessions
*   Placement Q&A panel
*   Internship Q&A panel
*   Speculative application session

Our academic team are also expanding this year, ready to support you through your university journey â€“ from workshops to revision sessions, we welcome our members to openly discuss academic topics to encourage learning.

name: Football - Women
description:
**LANCASTER UNIVERSITY WOMEN'S FOOTBALL CLUB (LUWFC)**
======================================================

![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/514716/original/20230917_142925.jpg)
=================================================================================================

We are a friendly club welcoming players of all abilities. Whether you're a complete begginer or a more experienced player, there is a place for you!
=====================================================================================================================================================

We currently have a 1st and 2nd team in BUCS and a 3rd team in a local recreational league. Our club also works closely with the Active Lancaster Programme, helping deliverÂ Turn Up and Play sessions.

**Training and Games**![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/431818/original/received_3152903774962632.jpeg)

Currently, each team trains twice a week on the 3G pitch:

*   MondayÂ 5:30-7pm (1s & 2s)
*   Thursday 5:00-6:30pm (3s)
*   Friday 6:30-8pm (1s, 2s & 3s)

Our 1sts and 2ndsÂ compete on Wednesdays in the inter-universityÂ BUCS league and our 3rd team usually play on a Sunday in a rec league against local teams. Our 3rd team are hoping to build onÂ last years success by winning their league again!Â 

We have 2 team![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/514734/original/3rd_Team.jpg)s thatÂ compete inÂ the largest inter-university sports tournament in Europe, **Roses.**Â Both 1sts and 2nds won their games at Roses 2022!Â 

Both our 1st and 2nd team each have a FA qualified coach that conducts training sessions and manages the team on match days. The 3rd team also have access to an experienced coach.

**Socials**

We hold weeklyÂ themed socialsÂ with fun activitiesÂ and teamÂ bondingÂ before taking advantage of the range of pubs and nightlife. Other socials are held throughout the year including a christmas meal, movieÂ nights, outdoor activities, team meals,Â watching footballÂ or attendingÂ live games. In term 3, there is usually an awards night,Â where the club gets together to celebrate the season.

Finally, we have an annual tour where we will travel abroad, play sports on the beach, visit local towns and also the local nightlife.Â 

**Membership Fees**![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/431811/original/received_1075932579677034.jpeg)

Our 23/24 annual membership fee is Â£30. Members of all three teams must also have a Sport Lancaster membership which can be purchased from the Sport Centre.

name: Hip Hop & Breakdance
description:
We are Lancaster University's official Hip Hop and Breakdance Society!Â We teach street dance, breakdance, popping, and locking, vogue, commercial, etc. We also hold regular workshops and collaborate with other societies.Â 

Classes are held every TuesdayÂ and ThursdayÂ with workshops every three weeks. There will be two free taster sessions for fresher's week, so do attend and vibe with us!

All the members come from different backgrounds and are all strangers turned friends through dancing, so don't hesitate to join the family!

Every year we take part in the GHGH (Go Hard or Go Home)Â UK dance competition and you can audition to become the competitionÂ team member. We additionally offer great opportunities toÂ perform for various events held on campus. We always look forward to welcoming new members!

https://www.facebook.com/hiphoplancs/

name: African Caribbean Society
description:
Lancaster University's African & Caribbean Society (ACS)Â was establishedÂ with the purpose of embracing and celebrating the rich and vibrant cultures within the African and Caribbean communities.

We are a society that treasures our culture whilst also accepting, welcoming, and promoting diversity and individuality. Our aim is to create a community that educates, entertains, empowers, and encourages our members to push themselves towards their success, no matter what success may look like to them.Â 

  
Hosting networking events,Â game nights, debates, mental and physical well-being seminars, and alumni talks, we aim to provide a variety of events for students to be able to effectively network and socialize with fellow students, as well as prompt awareness and appreciation about African and Caribbean heritage.

For more details and updates view our link treeÂ page at [https://linktr.ee/LancasterACS](https://linktr.ee/LancasterACS),andÂ our Instagram account @lancasteracsÂ where weâ€™ll keep you posted.

Thank you for taking the time to read about our society, and we at the Lancaster University African Caribbean Society look forward to seeing you soon.

**Membership Â£6.50 per year.**

name: Handball
description:
**Welcome to Lancaster University Handball Club!**  
  
**A bit about the club**

Lancaster University Handball Club (LUHC) is registered with the Students Union (LUSU) as the official Handball Club for Lancaster University and hosts both a men's and a women's team. The club was founded in 2013 by an overly-ambitious international student who had hoped to popularise handball in Lancaster as it was in her homeland of Norway. Since then, the club has grown rapidly into a fully-fledgedÂ community whith players of all levels.

**What we have to offer**

Here are a few things to entice you into joining:

*   We are a competitive club and play in a series of tournaments and matches throughout the year. Some of the highlights are the BUCS National Handball tournament and our annual Roses match against York University (which we are yet to lose!)
*   We are a diverse group of people with a range of experience and ability levels - there are plenty of players to learn from and we welcome anyone who wants to play, whetherÂ you're a pro or a complete beginner.
*   We are two teams but one club -Â having both a Mens+ team and a Womens+ team allows for plenty of collaboration in training and at our social events hosted throughout the year, from nights out at sugar to movie nights staying in

**Training**

We train every **Tuesday**Â fromÂ **15:45Â to 17:15** (Mens+) ,Â **17:15 to 18:45** (Womens+)Â and **Sunday** from **14:00Â to 15:30** (Mixed)Â atÂ the University Sports Centre.

  
**Membership**

Membership is just Â£35Â for the whole year. A Sport Lancaster (or any of the gym memberships from the University Sports Centre)Â membership isÂ required for Handball, after purchasing our membership. We are happy to help to show how to purchase this or have it added to an already existing gym membership!

**Contact information**

Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or queries about the club. Join us on Instagram ([lancs\_handball](https://www.instagram.com/lancs_handball/)) and also Facebook ([Lancaster University Handball Club](https://www.facebook.com/LancasterHandball/))! If you fancy trying out taster sessions will be held in the first weeks of term, or if you decide to join later in the year then message our page.Â Many of our players had never touched a handball prior to joining us!

Club email: handball.su@groups.lancaster.ac.uk

name: Swing Dance
description:
Swing is an umbrella term for a collection of Black American dances, danced to swing music, from the 1920s to 1940s. There are a variety of dances and at LUSwing, we mostly focus on Lindy Hop, an improvisedÂ partnerÂ dance which originated in the Black community of late 1920s Harlem, New York.

Inclusivity, acceptance and mutual respect are at the very core of Swing Dance. It is vital that we recognise the cultural context of Swing and acknowledge its black creators so that we may sustain the values of those to whom we owe so much and continue to promote a diverse, multicultural community welcome to all.

As part of the society, youâ€™ll be exposed to the culture and music of the swing era with live bands, social dance events and even weekend excursions in other scenes across the country! The swing dance community is a world-wide community that is incredibly friendly and welcoming.

name: Lithuanian Society
description:
Sveiki! Welcome!

  
Lithuanian society aims to unite Lithuanian students in Lancaster UniversityÂ by creating a family-like atmosphere where everyone isÂ welcome to connect with fellow natives, hang out and celebrate national holidays together. Creating a sense of safety and belonging in a foreign country is one of the most important factors for one's wellbeing, so we strive to create a space where everyone feels free to ask for help or just simply find someone to have a chat with.  
LithuanianÂ SocietyÂ gladly welcomes all new and returningÂ Lithuanian students toÂ join us!

Connect with us and see upcoming events in our Facebook group here!Â [https://www.facebook.com/groups/LTSoc](https://www.facebook.com/groups/LTSoc)

Iki pasimatymo!  
Lithuanian Society Exec Team

name: Christian Union
description:
Lancaster University Christian Union is a group of Christians on campus who seek to give every student at LancasterÂ University theÂ opportunity to hear and respond to the good news of Jesus Christ. We do this as a communityÂ and have events runningÂ throughout the week which you can choose to come along to as well as one off events throughout the year such as our Carol Service and Events Week! We look forward to seeing you there!Â 

  
See our website, facebook page or instagramÂ for more info:

name: LU Sing
description:
Welcome to Lancaster University Singing Society, also known as LU Sing! We're a group of amateur singers and musicians who meet up to both jam together casually and perform at events across campus on a regular basis. No auditions required!

Our main meetings usually take place on ThursdayÂ evenings from 6-8pm, with an additional musicians session taking place from 7-8pm on Mondays. We most commonly sing pop and rock songs, though we're more than willing to branch out and take suggestions too. We also go on regular socials, and perform at events such asÂ _Pendle Live!_, the annual fireworks display on campus and various extravs, so there's always something to do for everyone!

There's no pressure to perform if you don't want to, we're a relaxed group all about having fun and enjoying singing together, so if you like to jam then come give us a visit or send us a message on social media, we'd love to see you there!

Session Times:Â 

Monday: 7-8pm (Musician sessions) - Fylde LT3

Thursday: 6-8pm (Main sessions) -Â Fylde LT3

name: Lancaster Radical Youth Society
description:
Leaving home for the first time can be something of a challenging situation as young people; we understand the pressure and stress that University can bring into the life of a student and we believe having the right support from a group of other students who are going through similar situations can be very helpful.

Radical Youth is a student-led vibrant Youth Fellowship where students are encouraged in their faith. It is a Forum that welcomes everyone from different backgrounds who desire to grow in their faith.

There will be weekly fellowship meetings which consist of interactive sessions in which we discuss different topics about the Bible, we also pray and build great friendships. There are also opportunities to visit other regions and be a part of regional events. Radical Youth fellowships are environments in which we experience the presence of God through worship; whether it be worship through song or dance and drama ministrations at RY all regions events.

For more details join ourÂ [WhatsApp Group Chat](https://chat.whatsapp.com/FLIsh8BOtTK49htKxjBOKO)Â where we will keep you updated with meetings and events and follow our social media accounts.Â   
Â 

Facebook - [Radical Youth Lancaster Uni](https://www.facebook.com/RYLancs/)

Twitter -Â [https://twitter.com/ry\_lancs](https://twitter.com/ry_lancs)

Instagram - [@ry\_lancs](https://instagram.com/ry_lancs?igshid=1v12bvl12phpf)

name: Running and Athletics Club
description:
Lancaster University Running and Athletics Club aim to promote running both as a competitive sport and a healthy, sociable, recreational hobby.Â We are open toÂ all abilities, whether youâ€™ve never run, thrown or jumped a day in your lifeÂ or youâ€™re competing at the highest level - there is something forÂ everyone!Â We believe that although it is important to push yourself to the best you can be and to have a support of other like-minded athletes around, it is also hugely important to be an open and accessible club, which is why we welcome people of all abilities.

Our training captains also provide specialised training schedules based on people's abilities, so whether youâ€™re just looking to run your first 5K or training for your third marathon, we can help you out.Â We also organise a Couch to 5K group who work separately to our main group to achieve their personal goals.

As a club, we encourage everyone to take part in races, though this is not compulsory. As you all know, it's not about winning - it's the taking part that matters.Â We compete in many local road races, the Mid-Lancs Cross Country League, Steel Cup, the BUCS Cross Country races, the BUCS Track and Field events and some larger national races. The race distances vary a lot, from 60m to 800m, then all the way up toÂ a Full Marathon, meaning there is something for everyone!  
  
Social events are held every other week throughoutÂ term time andÂ all members are encouraged to attend. This is the best time to meet like-minded people and catch up with fellow club members. Our socials areÂ well known throughout the University forÂ being incredibly entertaining and enjoyable and we can promise you will have some great memories by the end of the year!

**When do we meet?**

We meet at 6pm on Mondays in the Pendle TV room (above Pendle Bar) for a variety of runs, such as 10k, 5k, Couch-to-5k and interval sessions, as well as atÂ 3pm on Wednesdays for a track session at Salt Ayre Leisure Centre. We also meet at 4pm on Sundays for circuit training in County South Lecture Theatre (during winter) or on the rugby pitches by Health Innovation campus (in summer).Â 

We look forward to meeting you all at our training sessions! Feel free to get in contact in the meantime if you have any questions.

Facebook:Â https://www.facebook.com/lancasteruniversityRAC/

name: Badminton
description:
![](https://assets.prod.unioncloud-internal.com/image/images/130787/optimized/21366724_10155790019389430_1770841149756776328_o.jpg)

Welcome to Lancaster University's Badminton Team page! We are a hard-working, inclusive and lively club, who train three timesÂ a week.

We are a competitive sports team, entering 2 Men's teams and 2Â Women's team into the BUCS leagues, comprising both singles and doubles.Â These matches are held on Wednesday afternoons throughout term time, with both home and away fixtures taking place.Â Additionally, we enter some players into Badminton England tournaments alongside the BUCS Individual Championships.Â 

Trials to be in the team for 2023/24Â will be held at the end ofÂ Freshers Week, in the sports center, further information will be released on our Facebook Page and Instagram:

Trials times 2023/24:

*   Sunday 8th October 4:00 - 6:00pm

So if you fancy training hard and meeting a great bunch of people while you are at it, then make sure you come down, and remember to bring your own racket!Â You can find more details about trials and other general information, as well as updates from the team, on our Facebook page ([http://facebook.com/LUBadmintonTeam](http://facebook.com/LUBadmintonTeam))Â and follow us on Instagram (lubadminton).

name: Dance: LUDanS
description:
LUDanS (Lancaster University Dance Society) is the largest dance society at the university!

TheÂ society offers weekly classes in a range of styles, including; Ballet, Tap, Jazz, Contemporary, Lyrical and Street. Some are taught by students and others by external, professional dance teachers. Each year the society hosts a two-day dance show for all members to take part in, as well as offering two opportunities to audition for a place on the range of intermediate and advanced teamsÂ that compete against other universities across the country throughout the year as well as competing in Europe's largest inter-university varsity competition, Roses, against York. This year we are also hosting our own home competition!

The society also provides numerous performance opportunities for both competition and non-competition members, hosts socials, puts on events and fundraises forÂ two charities: Positive Futures and Cancer Research UK.

For more information take a look at our website and social media pages, and message us with any questions :)

name: Magic and Circus Society (LUMACS)
description:
We are a fun and friendly society, welcoming people of all abilities. No experience is required to join! We host regular practice sessionsÂ and we offerÂ the opportunity to take part in paid performances both on and off campus.

Our circle of magicians are a mix of self-taught and trained teachers, allowing a flexible and fun space to learn or practice magic, ranging from card tricks to hypnotism to mentalist magic.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We also have aerial silks and hoop, a fantastic way to build amazing strength and flexibility!Â We offer weekly lessonsÂ and practice sessions within the society.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We offer memberships for weekday magic & circus skills sessions, weekend aerial skills sessions, or both. For important safety information, see the membership descriptions.

name: Lancaster University Society of History
description:
**WELCOME TO LUSH!!**

The Lancaster University Society of History (LUSH) is for any students who have a passion for history. You don't have to be studying historyÂ to become a member, we haveÂ plenty of people who join that do not study it!Â Ultimately, we aim to strike a balance between having fun nights out, some more settled events,Â and trips that will deepen our love of this fantastic subject.

**EVENTS TO EXPECT**

\- Trips to various historical locations (such as Lancaster Castle and local museums)Â 

\- Historically-themed nights out (we've previously had a 1920s, Wild Wild West and Historical Halloween)

\- Pub quizzes

\- Lectures from professional historians

\- Sober eventsÂ 

**WHAT YOUR MEMBERSHIP WILL GET YOU**

\- Queue jumpsÂ into The Sugarhouse for certain socials

\- Discounts on activities that the society offers (i.e. trips, tours)

\- Free entry into talks by academic speakers
